Summary Heading: Worst hotel stay in a Marriott branded hotel
Summary: My sister, sister in law and myself stayed at this hotel from April 17 to April 21, 2021.  We had several issues while staying there and have reached out to Marriott to discuss with no response other than an email saying the hotel would contact me.  That was more than two weeks ago and no one has contacted us which is the reason for a negative review.  I am a titanium elite lifetime member and can honestly say this was the worst hotel stay ever in a Marriott branded hotel.  Upon checkin they could not find the reservation, when it was finally found none of the notes that had been put on my reservation were even looked at.  Our room was not ready, after receiving a text that it was, so they said they would call my cell phone when it was ready.  Did not happen.  Then on Tuesday we
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review regarding your recent stay at the Residence Inn by Marriott Cypress Los Alamitos. We sincerely apologize for the issues that you experienced during your stay. I have spoken with the staff members at the front desk to ensure that all promises are kept and calls placed when rooms are initially not available. In regards to the water shut-off, it was our intention that every room be notified in advance regarding the repairs and planned the event to occur mid-day to minimize the impact on our guests. Clearly you were not notified and that is unacceptable. This will not happen again on any future improvement projects and the team will make sure to over communicate rather than risk even one guest not knowing about an event. Per our Covid policies, we do offer limited housekeeping service (every 3 days)  but your room should have been serviced even with limited water on Tuesday. I will research with the housekeeping department to determine why this was not done. The Residence Inn is committed to providing an outstanding experience for each of our guests and we apologize that we failed during your stay.  Thank you for staying with us during these unusual times. We appreciate your business and your loyalty to Marriott.

Summary Heading: Very poor quality Wifi and Streaming Service
Summary: Rooms and service are good, but don't depend on the internet. Free Wifi runs at about 5 Mbps. I paid for the enhanced internet in order to get a higher speed, that DOES NOT work. I called their tech support on a daily basis to get it resolved. I would get 50 Mbps for a few hours, but then would get it kicked back down to 5 or as little as 2 Mbps. This also affects the TV service. You can't watch any streaming service during the prime time of most of the guests being back. The TV streaming service simply won't load at all. I've never encountered this at any hotel I've stayed in, even in the early 2000s. I need the internet for work, so this issue is a deal breaker for this location.
Manager Response: Thank you Ryan19822531 for your valuable feedback. I apologize that the internet service is not working to the standard that you require. The hotel recently upgraded the bandwidth of the hotel and will be upgrading the internet equipment in late April 2021. In this upgrade, the hotel will be adding access points and upgraded equipment that can accommodate the needs of guests including using multiple devices as well as streaming services. This project has been in the planning stages for over a year and we are delighted to finally be able to complete the installation soon.  In the meantime, please contact me directly so that I can work with you and the internet provider to find a solution to your issues.  Thank you for choosing the Residence Inn Cypress Los Alamitos!

Summary: Had a nice 1 bedroom suite for the three of us, with a kitchen.  Comfortable.  The staff was very helpful, and the included breakfast yummy.  Nice stay for the long weekend, and the living room made it easy to catch up with friends.  Would stay there again.

Not the greatest Residence Inn but it is adequate.  Kitchenette is rather limited and does not have very many amenities.  Exercise room is very small and lacks adequate equipment.  Generally the place needs a remodel and have better amenities.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review the hotel.  I was sorry to hear that you were not satisfied with the full kitchen in your suite as well as the exercise room.  We strive to provide outstanding service and amenities to our guests. To that end, I am pleased to announce that we have added a Peloton to our exercise room! We now offer 2 treadmills, 1 elliptical, 1 Peloton and free weights in our exercise room.  In addition, coming in early 2020, we will change our coffee makers in the suite to a single cup Keurig machine. This new machine added to the full size refrigerator, dishwasher, cooktop, toaster, and dishes, pots and pans and silverware will help to elevate the kitchen in each suite.  In addition, if you prefer a larger kitchen, I would suggest booking one of our corner King Suites which has a full size oven in addition to the other amenities mentioned above. We look forward to hosting you again while you are in the Cypress area.

Summary: A group of us was put here for work this week, Easy to find, Check-in was easy. Rooms were very nice. The breakfast was good and fast. They have a grill next to the pool, which we used one night. Everybody here was very nice.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your excellent review!  I am delighted to hear that you were able to take advantage of our grill.  Join us during the summer months when the hotel hosts the Mix outdoors on Tuesday nights. Thank you for staying with us.  We look forward to your return.

Summary: 4 of our families were in town for a graduation and their property was perfect for us. The front desk was always very helpful. All the amenities were great for the kids. We also used the outdoor grill and patio area to have a mini reunion. We also loved the fact that this hotel accepted pets. It was perfect.
Manager Response: Thank you very much! I was happy to hear that were able to take advantage of everything the hotel has to offer (including bringing your furry friends).  We look forward to seeing you again soon!

Summary: The Hotel was very clean.  The employees were very helpful and nice.  Great place to stay for business or vacation.  I was there for business and I would go back with my family for vacation.  There was a very nice pool area as well as a basketball court.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review the hotel and for the kind comments. We appreciate your business and would be delighted to host you and your family on your next vacation.

Summary Heading: Smoking weed around toddler and infant
Summary: My family and I (wife, 2 year old and 8 month old daughters and I) have been staying at this hotel for a few days.  We are lifetime Titanium members so we have a good idea about what is normal behavior.   This whole week there have been some people staying here that stand in the parking lot just below our windows and smoke pot. That is a legal activity here in CA, but not one that should be done anywhere near where infants/toddlers live.   Even with the windows closed, it is easy to smell the weed.   Every time we have smelled the smoke, we contacted the front desk. We tell them that they are literally out there at that second, but apparently they don’t care enough to do anything quickly because when I ask why they don’t stop them from doing this, they say it is because when
Manager Response: Thank you for advising us of the issues that you experienced.  I was very concerned to hear about the marijuana odor that you reported. This activity is only legal in the privacy of a person's home and is not legal or condoned at the Residence Inn.  We take this very seriously and will immediately evict anyone who we can verify has been taking part in this activity. Upon reviewing the past few days reports, the hotel team checked 4 times for this odor and activity but were unable to find anyone.  Rest assured, had we found any activity, immediate action would have been taken.  As for the homeless lady, the hotel did contact the police immediately and she was removed from the hotel and arrested for trespassing.  I have worked at this hotel since opening in 2002 and this has never happened before! The City of Cypress is a very secure neighborhood of homes and businesses with an excellent police department that responds quickly to any concern. The Residence Inn team strives to provide outstanding service and hotel suites to every guest. I apologize that you did not experience this during your stay.

Summary: Best choice for some days of vacation, everyone was really nice to us and helped us in everything we needed. The pool and outside jacuzzi were amazing and we had delicious breakfast every morning we were at the hotel. Definitely recommended.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind comments.  We look forward to your next stay!

Summary: First time to stay here and our experience was relaxing, we usually book our hotels near Disneyland where everything is busy but this location is a gem. Not crowded, nice staff with breakfast included. Going to Disneyland using Lyft cost us $15 which is actually not bad since we dont have to deal with parking hustle and parking fees. Lots of food options around.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  I was glad to hear of your experience getting to Disneyland. With Star Wars Land opening at the end of May, our location only 8 miles away, is a great option for visitors who want to stay out of the busy activity in the Anaheim area.  We look forward to your next stay!

Summary: I've had conversations with Lisa over the years regarding different policies which I don't necessarily agree with (as a Marriott Gold), she is always receptive, and will generally explain her perspective. However, in the bigger picture, I like this hotel and return frequently. On this particular occasion, I was pleased to find the folks at reception very warm and friendly, as well as the staff at breakfast the following morning.  The airport is close enough to LGB to be practical, and on the other end, it is close enough to Disneyland to be an inexpensive Uber away (if you were so inclined). The hotel is ALWAYS clean, and is located in a safe and comfortable area.  Costco is just a block away if you are going to enjoy an extended stay.  Definitely a worthwhile pick.
Manager Response: Thank you for review of the Residence Inn Cypress Los Alamitos.  We are pleased to be centrally located for both business and leisure travelers.  The team works hard to maintain the hotel and provide outstanding service. We appreciate your business!

Summary: We usually stay at the Courtyard, but the Residence came up the same price and it includes b'fast, so we thought we'd give it a tr.  No problem checking in at 2PM, which was nice, and we asked for a quiet room so they put us far from Katella, a busy road.  Rooms are LARGE, with a full kitchen, with 2/3 sized fridge, stove and microwave, and dishwasher.  Staff runs your dirty dishes/glasses thru the dishwasher even if only a couple have been used.  Bed is comfy.  Not great water pressure in shower.  B'fast was surprisingly good with friendly staff.  Lots of kinds of yogurt, 2 waffle "machines", 3 hot dishes (scrambled eggs + 2 meats that changed each day), bananas, bagels, and oatmeal
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review. We are always happy to provide early check-in when rooms are available. As you noted, the complimentary hot breakfast buffet is extensive and offers several rotational items including breakfast breads such as chocolate croissants and apple coffee cake. We look forward to your next stay.

Summary: Jackie from Food and Beverage is the best!!!! During the week they have social Mix's and one of the nights they changed the time without notice. So when my friends and I walked in, the Mix was over. Jackie was so nice, she made us fresh chocolate chip cookies and gave us a glass of wine. That's SUPERB customer service!!!!   The hotel is clean and the staff is friendly, however if you call the front desk to ask them to bring you towels or toiletries you probably wont get it. I dont know if they're lazy or just forgetful. Other than that, it's in a great location and walking distance from food places.
Manager Response: We love Jackie too!  I apologize for the time change on the Mix.  We had a bit of a miscommunication. I'm so glad you were taken care of in such a kind and considerate manner. I do apologize that you had an issue with receiving items requested from the front desk. We have a new process in place that will eliminate those issues. Thank you for staying with us!

Summary Heading: Wet Carpets, Dirty Windows, Dirty Cups.
Summary: I have always had a good opinion of the various Marriott properties. This particular one however is a $200 a night letdown. This property is designed so the front desk is a stand-alone building with 2 adjacent structures housing the rooms,. I arrived and paid for my room. Non refundable by the way. When I arrived at the entrance to the building my room was in there was a notice that they were cleaning the carpets in all the rooms. Both buildings had the notice. There is no notice in or on the building housing the front desk.  I went up to my room to find that the carpet had already been cleaned. You see I could tell by the fact that it was still wet. There were 2 letters on the desk. One announcing that they are cleaning the rooms and that you may be asked to leave your room for
Manager Response: We recognize your time is valuable and appreciate the feedback you have provided on Trip Advisor  Maintaining a fresh and clean atmosphere within our guest rooms and common areas is always a key priority. On behalf of the entire team at Residence Inn Cypress Los Alamitos, I sincerely apologize for falling short of not only meeting your expectations, but ours as well. Rest assured, the feedback provided will be shared with the appropriate hotel team to ensure we consistently deliver upon guest expectations. The hotel is in the process of having the carpets professionally cleaned which we do twice a year along with our own cleaning.  I am sorry that your stay was disrupted by this process.    I will contact you directly to ensure that the remainder of your stay is enjoyable and that you are provided the type of hotel experience that Marriott is known for.

Summary Heading: Worst Experience in a Marriott Brand Hotel
Summary: We stayed recently at this Residence Inn and was totally disappointed with how the hotel is managed! We stayed for two nights and we left the room around 8 in the morning on the second day even put a couple of dollars for the housekeeping. We returned around 710 pm to our astonishment with the room smelling awful and totally untouched the whole day! Housekeeping didn’t even come in to our room! The used towels were smelly! I called the font desk and the person on duty stated that sorry there is no one in housekeeping and they won’t come back till tomorrow! Is this how Marriott expect their employees to respond to a problem? Finally she stated that she will try to see if she can get ahold of someone and will give me a call back. Ten minutes passed and no phone call. I decided to
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know of your experience. I would like to speak with you directly in order to identify when the housekeeping error occurred so that we can ensure that this does not happen to anyone else. I sincerely apologize that your room was not cleaned and that the front desk was not able to solve the problem.  Please contact me at the hotel at your earliest convenience.

Summary: With a four day notice to vacate our 2B/2B apartment for fumigation, I relied on a local Residence Inn as I needed work space, fast internet, an actual bedroom and kitchenette with full size refrigerator and stove top burners.  Wonderful staff fulfilling my request for quiet room with easy access to unload and load car.  Suite was very clean and comfortable, free daily breakfast was welcoming, grounds are well kept.  I did not join the weekday after-work social events but great way to get out of your room and meet new people. Again, never disappointed with Marriott.
Manager Response: Thank your for choosing the Residence Inn Cypress Los Alamitos for your unexpected stay.  We appreciate your review and glad that you enjoyed the hotel, staff and breakfast.  Next time, when you stay for fun, you will have to join us for the evening Mix!  Our new beer and wine pairing events on select Wednesday evenings are an excellent way to relax and unwind.

Summary Heading: Good hotel in need of a refresh
Summary: The staff are helpful, friendly, and accommodating and they make up the bulk of this positive review, even if the words about them are few.   The pool is nice and a welcome respite from the heat. The breakfast is your standard Residence Inn breakfast with several hot options. Sometimes the items could stand to be changed earlier than they are. For example, if the pineapple is brown, it should not be brought out. But the workers in the breakfast area work so hard to make the best experience.   My issue is with the cleanliness of the room. I had the same impression during my first stay here but thought I would give it a second try. The desk is one of the rooms was so dusty, I could write my name in it; there were hairs in the bathroom, floor and on the toilet, and the shower
Manager Response: We recognize your time is valuable and appreciate the feedback you have provided.  Maintaining a fresh atmosphere within our guest rooms and common areas is always a key priority. On behalf of the entire team at Residence Inn Cypress Los Alamitos, I sincerely apologize for falling short of not only meeting your expectations, but ours as well. Rest assured, the feedback provided will be shared with the appropriate hotel team to ensure we consistently deliver upon guest expectations.  Thank you for your kind words regarding the staff and especially the breakfast team.

Summary: Clean hotel and convenient to many businesses and restaurants.  The hotel is split between two buildings so getting around is a  bit confusing however service is good and rooms are clean.  I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review.  The hotel staff works very hard to provide outstanding service and clean rooms for all of our guests. We will see you next time!

Summary: Stayed here for 12 nights when I was in the area on business. I liked the location very much.  The staff was very polite and friendly, very accommodating to my requests. The common areas of the hotel were nice and always clean. Breakfast was good, great selection of food. The room looked nice and was probably recently painted but furniture needs to be updated. Bed and pillows were comfortable. I would have liked a more powerful shower head but it did its job. The battery in one of the smoke detector in my room died one evening and the detector started beeping continuously. Front desk notified the in-house engineer who knocked on my door 5 minutes later, if that. I was very happy with the quick response. Midway through my stay I received a check-out confirmation in my e-mail
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to review the hotel after your extended stay.  The Residence Inn brand is purpose built for travelers like yourself who need a home away from home while traveling on business or pleasure.  I'm glad to hear that all issues were corrected quickly and with a friendly attitude.  We hope to see you again in the near future!

Summary: Stayed here several times and have never had a bad experience. The Staff is always kind, friendly and knowledgeable of the area. The hotel is not far from Disneyland, California Adventure and Knotts Berry Farm.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your kind review.  As you mentioned, the hotel is centrally located in the Orange County/Los Angeles area to many fun things to do including Disneyland, CA Adventure, Knott's Berry Farm, beaches, museums and the Long Beach Aquarium.    We look forward to your next visit!

Summary: We stayed here for a month and had numerous housekeeping problems.  Although we discussed problems with the front desk and they tried to sort things out we kept having problems until the day we met the manager, Lisa, in the hall way.  She asked how our stay was and we told her about all the housekeeping issues.  She was very apologetic and much to our surprise the next day housekeeping apologized and they actually gave our room a thorough cleaning.  We had no problem after that and we really appreciated the extra effort the manager made to make sure things were corrected. The hotel breakfast buffet is very good and when the hotel is full the eating area is not big enough to accommodate everyone but other than that I must say that the buffet staff are very good at replenishing
Manager Response: Thank you for giving me the opportunity to correct the issues that you experienced with the housekeeping department. I have spoken with each associate to ensure that this was a one time issue and will not happen again.  I'm so glad to hear that you enjoyed the breakfast and especially our terrific associate, Erolyn.  We hope to see you again whenever your travels bring you to the Cypress/Los Alamitos area.

Summary: We stayed for 2 nights in a 2-bedroom suite. The room was clean and looked updated although some furniture, like the coffee table looked old and worn out. The beds and the pillows were too soft. The tv in the living area seemed small for the size of the room. No Netflix or other streaming capabilities on the TVs either. Breakfast was decent although crowded, as expected. Parking was free and always available. I would suggest requesting a room on the top floor to avoid hearing loud footsteps above you. And also not facing Katella St as the street noise is bothersome. Location was good and close enough to Disney and Long Beach.

Summary Heading: One of the best Residence Inns
Summary: We stay at Residence Inns often as we travel with a teenager and need two bedrooms. This was one of the best. Clean and the furnishings were all comfortable. The front desk staff were terrific. We arrived at 4PM and rooms were not ready due to some issues with housekeeping. We waited about 30 minutes and without asking, the front desk team changed our rate to something slightly lower than what we had booked. We didn't ask for this, they did it on their own. Clearly the staff have been trained to make independent decisions. The breakfast was perfectly fine. We would definitely recommend this hotel. It is about a 20 minute drive to Disneyland. Plenty of restaurants nearby as well as a Vons grocery store.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind comments regarding the Residence Inn Cypress Los Alamitos and the staff.  I apologize that your room was not ready at 4pm but delighted that the staff took such great care of you.  The two bedroom suites are a unique suite type that are a great option for families traveling together.  With two bedrooms, two bathrooms, a living area with a sofabed and three TV's, everyone has a comfortable stay.  We look forward to seeing you the next time your travel brings you to the Cypress area.

Summary: We were here on a quick visit to LA area after attending a wedding.  We chose this location since it's not very far from Disney and not too close to where you'd pay the Disney price.  Staff, as expected from Marriott, was great, very helpful and engaging.  Our unit was 2BR/2BA on the 3rd floor.  The breakfast buffett was good and plentyful.  Parking is free, the hotel is clean and looks like newly renovated.  I would stay again if we're in the area.

Apparently freshly remodeled. Squeaky clean. I loved the super toilet, great lamps/lighting, plenty of outlets,  light switches, big, clean fridge, good tv with lots of channels, very comfortable bed and pillows, best desk chair (I’m going to get one of those!), and plenty of space. Problem-free WiFi. The staff were friendly and professional. It was quiet, although very full judging from the parking lot. We were there on horse business, so it was extremely convenient to Los Al track. I really enjoyed staying here.
Manager Response: Thank you for the Trip Advisor Review.  We appreciate it!  As you noticed, the hotel completed a renovation in May 2016.  The staff takes great pride in the new product and keeps the hotel super clean!  Thank you for staying with us and we look forward to seeing you the next time you are in the area.

Summary Heading: Last here three and a half years ago
Summary: The physical aspects of the hotel have not changed. Still pleasant and comfortable. I handed the clerk my license at check-in, with the interaction from 2014 still fresh in my mind. I don't know if he copied it, but it certainly wasn't as obvious as in the past.  My only issue with the check in was that when I asked the gentleman for a top floor room, he was unable to comply (I'm Marriott Gold), but his colleague overheard the conversation, and made the change.  Room is pleasant, well stocked, and parking ample.  Still a nice choice in Orange County.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us! We're glad you enjoyed your stay and that we were able to accommodate your request for a top floor room. We look forward to seeing you again soon..

Summary: Stayed there as it is close to Cottonwood Church. It's a small but good hotel. Breakfast was ok but unremarkable with the usual stuff-  cereal, eggs and sausage etc. Room was a good size and well equipped.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at the Residence Inn Cypress Los Alamitos.  We appreciate your business and for taking the time to write a review on the hotel.  Breakfast is included every day and includes many rotational items including croissants, crumb coffee cake and even bacon on Thursdays! We hope that you will be able to enjoy the variety on your next stay.

Summary Heading: Spacious suites for a big family
Summary: Centrally located halfway between Orange County and Downtown LA, the Residence Inn is a good place to explore all of metro LA, but you'll need to drive everywhere.  Parking is free and plentiful unless you arrive late at night.  The 2 bedroom/2 bath suites are spacious, with a fold-out sofa bed in the living room as well, so 6 people can be accomodated.  The fold-out sofa bed was uncomfortable to sleep in, so our 5th person just slept on the cushions which turned out to be just fine.  The 2 queen beds in each of the bedrooms was too soft for my tastes as well.  Otherwise, with 3 TV's, free WiFi, and 2 generous baths and a full kitchen with utensils, cookware, and dishes, it accomodates a large active family.  On the grounds is a basketball court and a nice outdoor swimming pool.

Enjoyed our 4 night visit here.  Friendly staff from reception to housekeeping. Our clean, spacious & modern room included a kitchen area.  Firm bed w/good bedding.  Good bathroom design w/vanity & sink separated from the shower/toilet.  Only 3 floors so we never had to wait endlessly for an elevator - we could opt for stairs and a bit of exercise instead.  A minor negative was an intermittent noise coming from the air conditioner which unfortunately seemed amplified at night.  Free internet but slow service or connectivity issues.  Complimentary breakfast buffet included a coffee station & make-your-own waffles plus healthy choices:  juices, fresh fruit, yogurt & oatmeal.  Hot choices varied daily but included scrambled eggs and various sausages/bacon.  Multi sports court

Summary Heading: Not What It Used to Be
Summary: This used to be a great place to stay. Because we have family in the area, this has always been our go to place to stay. When we arrived, we noticed that the place looked in need of an update. The outside of the building looked dull as if it needed a paint job. The rooms were fine but the buffet breakfast was more limited in food selections. The morning  we are there, there was no bacon, no pancakes, No pastries-all choices that were usually found in abundance. There was limited fruit and scant yogurt. The staff remains very pleasant.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  I was disappointed to hear of your dissatisfaction with the breakfast offerings.  Marriott upgraded the Residence Inn breakfast in 2016. It now includes the following: scrambled eggs, make-your-own waffles, rotating meat offerings including bacon on Thursdays, Greek yogurt, rotational fresh fruit, rotational pastries including chocolate croissants, cinnamon rolls and coffee cake, breads, cereals and oatmeal.  The exterior of the buildings were painted in January 2016 and the parking lot was resurfaced in September 2016.  The interior of the hotel was renovated completely in 2016 as well.  Thank you for your comments regarding the staff.  They work very hard to provide outstanding service to every guest every day. We appreciate your business and hope to see you again soon.

Summary: We arrived at midnight after a very long flight , the front desk man was unfriendly, he gave us a room in the ground floor next to the elevator engine room , we refused to take it he said we have one room left take it or leave it, he did nit bother his self to solve this matter, we was so tired so we accept to sleep that night .. but we did not sleep that night because the room was so noisy and we were listening for a water leakage from upper room when they use their bathroom we thought it just a water sound but suddenly my husband got wet when he was on the bathroom from upper bathroom leaking , he got wet with other people waste .. so disappointed with the hotel and the management, we checked out in early morning and went to better hotel .. we are so mad and disappointed with
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know of your dissatisfaction with your suite. Unfortunately, during the summer months, we have very high occupancy and there were no other suites available at that time.  We would have been happy to move you to a different room the next day.  I assure you that, while there was a water leak, it was not a leak from the toilet, but rather from a broken tub spout.  I apologize that you had to experience this maintenance issue. Please know that this is not a common issue and that we are so very sorry that you felt you had to move to a new hotel.

Summary: What can you say?  Residence Inn is consistent with spaciousness, amenities, cleanliness, comfort.  This one didn't disappoint.  Breakfast is included in the morning and has your usually eggs, sausage, and another turkey or veggie sausage option.  Love he tortillas and toppings if you wanted a breakfast burrito.  Yogurts, bagels, English muffin, oatmeal , cereal, juice and coffee.    The bed was comfortable, the shower clean, lighting was spot on.  I'm thinking about staying here from now on. As my company is leas than a mile away.   Staff was courteous and I enjoyed my stay.  Thank you!
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind comments.  We would be delighted to host you whenever you are in the Cypress Los Alamitos area!

Summary: Front Desk Team: Very Friendly. Lex is funny . Her jokes make everyone laugh.  It was delightful.   Breakfast Team: Super Amazing. The breakfast is really delicious. Karen is amazing and delivers 5 star service.  Barar is upbeat.  You can literally hear her laughing as soon as you walk into the lobby.  It makes the whole hotel feel cheerful.  Erolyn is so thoughtful.  He made waffles for my family and also brought bottles of water to my kids when we were swimming at the pool.  Freddy is also a cool lady.  She makes the best sweet bread in the morning and is very positive even early in the morning.   Dinner Team: Very Healthy. I heard about the Residence Inn "mom" Raquel from the Internet.  She works hard and takes care to make the food healthy.  I saw her preparing the salad

We needed a place to stay while our home was being tented and would accept small dogs.  One thing that I noticed is their friendly service, whenever I ran into a staff member they always greeted me.  The room was perfect for our needs, two adults and two small dogs.  The WiFi worked great, loved that they had HBO since one of us was always in the room,  The area around the hotel is nice, with a small dedicated area for dogs.    Location was decent.  Could walk to a couple of places to get some food, but it does seem a tiny bit isolated.  Not a problem if you have a car, there are plenty of places to eat within 5 minutes.  Loved the "free" breakfast in the morning.  Rather limited in menu, but they did have hot food available.  I would stay here again if I needed to stay with our
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of the Residence Inn Cypress Los Alamitos.  Residence Inn is purpose built for the extended stay traveler with all the amenities of home.  Just like home, pets are welcome!  I have shared your comments with my staff and we appreciate your kind words regarding our service.  Hopefully, you will not need to tent your home again, but know that we are here to welcome you back if you ever need to stay again.

Summary: This hotel is very dirty. We checked in the evening. After my shower, I reached for a towel and saw the nicely folded towel had blood stains on it! My husband unfolded the sofa bed and saw about 3 strands of what appear to be pubic hair! My daughter was already sleeping so  I decided to stay because we had already move our luggages up the 4th floor already. This is a very disappointing experience because I chose this hotel based on the other reviews and since it was recently renovated. The renovation is basically a cosmetic makeover of the extremely old and dirty rooms. Just covering up the old and dirty. The ceiling still had that old popcorn ceiling. We found a long blonde hair strand in stuck to the vanity cabinet. And an old bottle of water half finish under the sofa bed
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review the hotel.  As you can imagine, I am appalled that you experienced such a disappointing stay.  Please know that the state of your room is not normal.  The hotel is frequently complimented on the cleanliness and satisfaction scores are over 90%.  I have shared your comments with the housekeeping department to ensure that this is an isolated issue and that our future guests do not experience a similar stay.  The hotel did complete a 3 million dollar renovation in 2016 that included a new updated color scheme, carpet, paint, wallpaper, furniture and new mattresses.  We hope that you will give the hotel a 2nd chance so that we can provide you with the outstanding product and service that Residence Inn is known for.

Summary: I have stayed at a lot of Residence Inn hotels. This one was above average. Friendly staff, clean rooms*, comfortable bed, good location. The free wifi was SLOW, as usual, and the free breakfast was good. The orange juice was addictive, & very refreshing! The fresh fruit was sweet & tasty! On Saturday, they had some sort of danish/sheet cake with a thick layer of brown sugar, butter & cinnamon, highlighted by streaks of white glaze on top. It was DELICIOUS! I had a large piece, I could have had seconds!!! *There was one small exception. There were a couple of long black hairs in my bed. I quickly checked to see if the sheets had been changed! I determined they had, & maybe the hair fell from the head of the housekeeping staff member. Upon careful inspection, the rest of the
Manager Response: Thank you for your review!  We are so glad you enjoyed your stay and especially the breakfast.  I apologize about the hairs on the bed and have shared those comments with my housekeeping staff so that other guests will never experience that issue.  We hope to see you again in the future!

Summary Heading: Will Stay Here Again for Sure
Summary: This hotel provides very good values and quality stays if you are visiting Long Beach and north Orange County area. The rooms are clean and nicely furnished. The beds are very comfortable. The staff very friendly and make you feel welcomed. As Costco is a must go place for me when I visit America, I like it that there's one next door! Restaurants and shops in Seal Beach Blvd just a short drive. 405 and 605 freeways also a short drive away taking you to south OC in 20 mins and LA in 30 - 40 mins. I visit LA at least a couple times a year and this hotel is now on my list of choice.
Manager Response: Great!  We will see you next time!

Summary: This hotel has all you need for a family and/ friends vacation. My friends and I got a two bedroom/ two bath with a living section. We were very comfortable and satisfied with all the amenities. The staffing was great at helping was decide on a Tour. There's plenty of restaurants and grills/bars in the vicinity and shopping within a 3mi radius. The decision on what to have for breakfast may be challenge,because it was all fresh and good.

Celebrating my mom's 90th Birthday and needed a place close by. This Residence Inn was the perfect place with all the amenities of home. Recently renovated, the hotel felt like new.  My son and grandson were able to stay with us and we had plenty of room.  The complimentary breakfast was fantastic!  So many choices. Our grandson loved making his own Belgium waffles.  Helpful and friendly staff.  Will come back again!

The room was great, very clean. The staff was very accommodating,and friendly. Jean at the front desk did a great job at getting us set for the night. Breakfast was also very good. Have stayed here before and have always had a great experience!

The hotel looks recently remodeled so it is clean and modern. Staff are extremely nice and helpful. No ice machine on property, which to me is odd (first time I've ever encountered that), but the great Front Desk Are quick to grab you a bag of ice to take back to your room.   Overall, a great experience and will definitely remember this place when we come back to the area.

Pros: good breakfast and a few free dinners as well! The rooms are very nice. Great location, near Seal Beach and Huntington Beach. Also, the Poky Doky is so yummy!  Cons: their laundry machines only take quarters. But if you don't have quarters, the staff won't give you any. You have to fun over to the bank which is a quarter mile walk to get the quarters you need. My advice is that the front desk be capable of giving change or they have machines that take cards. You can't offer an amenity you can't support your guests in using. It was very inconvenient.

I usually don't write reviews but I really wanted to thank and acknowledge the fantastic staff at Residence Inn Cypress Los Alamitos for outstanding service.   I arrived earlier on Thursday morning 4 August after a 13 hour flight from Australia and was greeted by a lovely lady named Jeanette at check in.   After a very long flight Jeanette was genuinely friendly, helpful, efficient and made my early morning check in a breeze. I travel a lot and it's nice when you are greeted by someone who can anticipate what a hotel guest needs straight away and can organise things seamlessly.   At check out I once again was greeted by two lovely ladies who were both cheerful and efficient. Great service again.  Overall it's sometimes the small things that when all added up makes your stay so

Summary Heading: Great hotel for families visiting Disney
Summary: Absolutely loved the hotel. Right on Katella which can you can take all the way to Disneyland. Generous breakfast with options for all tastes.  Beer and wine in the evening. Free parking. We went in December so didn't use the pool plus we spent all the time in Disney. Would highly recommend. Plenty of eating places if you head down to Los Alamitos Blvd including an In-n-Out burger

Great hotel, great rooms newly renovated , great pool, good breakfast. People from the hotel very kinds, helpful and trying to help you with all your demands. This is the third time I am staying at this hotel I am very pleased with all the services they have.

Staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was plentiful and good.  Room was excellent.  Spacious clean and comfortable.  Housekeeping staff were great.  Work around my schedule and needs.  I would recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: Good For a Stay Near Long Beach
Summary: I was visiting out-of-town relatives who booked my family a room here. It was a suite-style room with a small kitchen, desk, table, TV, and pull-out sofa bed in the one room and a normal bedroom (with queen bed), sink, and bathroom in the other.   The hotel and room was nice...clean and well-appointed. There was plenty of space for the three of us.  The pull-out sofa bed was fine, nothing spectacular, but suitable for two nights. It didn't appear that there were blankets or pillows for me to use, so we just borrowed a thin blanket and a pillow off the bed. I can't personally speak for the comfort of the queen bed, but my family said it was a little firm. Depending on your preference, maybe you'll like that.  Free high-speed internet worked well and was easy to connect.   The

Summary Heading: Great for family with young kids
Summary: Great place stay if you are visiting Disneyland but also want to just relax for few days. Most rooms has nice small kitchen. Hotel has good enough breakfast, nice swimming pool, hot pool and basket ball. That keeps kids busy.

We enjoyed our stay, the room was very nice, updated and quiet. Free parking and great free buffet breakfast. Only negative for us was the guy at the front desk - not very welcoming and twice we came back after a long day out with sleeping toddler in arms only to be locked out. Not ideal having to stand outside with sleeping toddler in arms waiting for our room key card to be reactivated so we could get into our room.. Two days in a row this happened, turned out this unfriendly front desk guy had twice mistakenly put our end date as the next day, but we were booked and paid for 4 nights. It was only the second time it happened when a female staff member told us and fixed the problem. Otherwise I would have rated 5 stars of not for the service.

My husband and I and our chihuahua stayed here last October during a visit to Disneyland.  I love the Marriott brand and this Residence Inn did not disappoint.  It is about 8 miles from Disneyland but I'm so happy we stayed here and not closer to the park.  The drive there was very short and we also went to the Pacific Aquarium in Long Beach which was maybe 20 minutes away.  It's also close to Knottsberry Farm, a huge Krikorian movie theater in Buena Park, and South Coast Plaza in OC.  Most people on vaca don't go to Costco but in case the need arises, there is one very close by.  The grounds were clean and well maintained with outdoor barbeque, pool, and basketball courts.  There was ample outdoor parking at no charge.  The included breakfast had a lot of great options for us

We stayed here for 3 nights while visiting Disneyland.  While it's not within walking distance, you get a lot more room for your money than the hotels in the park area.  There is a very nice breakfast included in the room price.

Nice place for a family stay. We spent a couple of days in the hotel in a trip to Disney and Universal. Nice comfortable room. Free parking and normal Residence Inn type breakfast not much variety, but what you need to start the day.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding your stay with us.  I'm glad that you enjoyed your suite.  By May 20th, all suites will be completely remodeled with new carpet, paint, wallpaper, mattresses and furniture.  Residence Inn will also be launching a new updated breakfast this year with more healthy options.  Currently, we offer scrambled eggs, sausage or turkey canadian bacon, breakfast potatoes, a rotational hot item, make your own waffles, breakfast breads and muffins, fresh fruit, oatmeal, cereals, yogurt and yogurt parfaits.  We are looking forward to the new items that will be added - coming soon!

Summary: The biggest problem I had with this hotel was that none of its rooms have king size beds.  Nor two queen size beds, unless you book a two bedroom unit.  We knew this going in, but had no choice as the hotel we usually stay in was booked for the week. The kitchen is nice, but the living room area was not that spacious. There was a hide a-bed in the living room.  The bedroom had one queen bed and barely enough room to walk around to the other side of it.  It is designed for a single business traveler who doesn't have to share space.  For that specific individual, I would rate it a Very Good.  The breakfast buffet was good and the seating area around it was big enough that you didn't have to fight for a table.  The pool appeared to be nice, but the weather was coolish when we were
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your experience at the Residence Inn Cypress Los Alamitos.  You will be happy to know that as part of the on-going hotel renovation, we are adding King size beds to our corner studio suites.  This open-planned style room is approximately 20 square feet bigger than the standard studio or one bedroom suite.  Unfortunately, due to size limitations, we do not offer any suites with 2 queen size beds other than the two bedroom, two bathroom suite.  We look forward to seeing you again when the renovation is complete.

Summary: We really liked this Residence Inn because of location of things to do in Los Alamitos & Los Angeles. This hotel was really clean, good sized rooms & comfortable beds. Everything else was up a normal Residence Inn quality of breakfast, nice kitchenette etc. Just a nice property
Manager Response: Thank you for the great review!  Just wanted to let you know that our beds are about to get even more comfy as we are adding all new mattresses in the renovation.  See you soon!

Summary Heading: Good place for a weekend visit
Summary: Spent President's Day weekend here while visiting family.  Comfortable room with a kitchenette that offers basic furnishings.  Microwave, dishwasher, two burner stove top, but no oven.  Bathroom well appointed.  Pullout couch mattress is awful.    Nice breakfast included, with cereals, bagels, muffins, waffle maker, oatmeal, and a rotating selection of hot items such as potatoes, sausage, and those nasty, rubbery, powdered eggs.  There's enough variety for several days.  The hotel grounds are well cared for, including a nice pool and spa, a multi sport court, and a gas barbecue grill.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  I am delighted that you enjoyed your stay with us. Please note that if you do require an oven in a future stay, our corner studio suites as well as most two bedroom suites do have ovens.  I was sorry to hear about your sofabed mattress. We will be receiving all new sofa's and mattresses with our renovation which begins in just a few days.  Also coming in 2016 is a new Residence Inn breakfast with additional healthy options.  Our current eggs are cage free, whole eggs that come in a carton. I apologize that they were rubbery on the day of your stay. I have spoken with the food and beverage attendants to make sure that this does not happen again.  We look forward to your next visit!

Summary Heading: Quaint, Environ Friendly Suites w/ Great Full Breakfast!!
Summary: We were in town one nite for a marriage conference at Cottonwood Church, it was a powerful meeting. We wanted a hotel we seem "branded" to, but guess what... it was Valentines Day weekend and everything was full. We ended up at this cute place where the price was good and the staff made it even better. :)  The suite has a full refrigerator and microwave in the kitchen, is very spacious, with separate living and bed area. Loved the water efficient toilet, and energy efficient lights.  Here's a heads up for visitors who come looking for rest (at any Residence Inn Mariott). At 8pm we were bombarded with noise from the room above us, seemingly from a group of children jumping and running. We called the desk and they apparently made a call. It stopped for an hour, and resumed until
Manager Response: Thank you for reviewing the Residence Inn Cypress Los Alamitos. We appreciate your kind comments regarding our staff and suites.  I am very sorry to hear that you were disturbed by noise during your stay.  This is not a normal issue as we do take our No Disturbance Policy very seriously.  We hope to see you again when your travels take you back to Cypress/Los Alamitos.

Summary: I am a Marriott Rewards Member and so I am used to the Residence Inns being pretty top notch when we visit.  This was not the case at this location. We checked in and found that the room was very outdated, like 1998 Residence Inn bedroom and furniture and bathroom, but with 2008 kitchen upgrades.  The carpet was icky, and there was blood spatter on the bathroom wall, old brownish/red blood splatter. I wondered if someone had gotten beaten/killed in the restroom and maybe this room was forgotten during the renovation... The shower drained slowly, and the bed was old. The bedding was okay. We only stayed 2 nights, but my daughter (who is 10) was immediately ready to go home after the first night. She kept asking me, "Mommy this is not like our normal hotels, it's yucky". For a
Manager Response: Thank you for providing feedback regarding your stay at the Residence Inn Cypress Los Alamitos. I was disappointed to hear that the cleanliness in your room was below standards.  I have shared this information with the housekeeping staff to ensure that they are cleaning all areas of the suite including the walls.  You will be happy to know that although the hotel was last renovated in 2008, we will be renovating again beginning on February 22nd 2016.  The renovation includes new furniture and mattresses. It sounds like you stayed at the hotel over President's Day/Valentine's Day weekend which was a very busy weekend and our guests did include two sports teams.  The kitchen works very hard to keep up but it sounds like they were overwhelmed with the volume of guests. We will make sure to add additional staff when we forecast another weekend such as you experienced. We do hope to see you again and demonstrate our commitment to providing a clean hotel with a very friendly staff.

Summary: We stayed there in December 2015. Hotel is nice, located in safe area. We liked Los Alamitos with its parks and playgrounds, closeness to Los Angeles.  Nice breakfast. It has everything you need. Real Marriott chain member!
Manager Response: Thank you!  We have many improvements up-coming in 2016.  Can't wait to have you review us again when we have completed our renovation.

Summary Heading: Good hotel with good breakfast options!!!
Summary: Stayed in this hotel for a month. I never felt I was staying in a hotel. It was more like a home. We stayed in a studio suite. For people like me who need a big kitchen to cook everyday, this is the best place.  Housekeeping was very nice. They used to come daily and replace towels etc. The towels and  bedspreads were replaced frequently.The hotel staff is very helpful. As we didn't have car for the first few days, they always dropped us by their shuttle to nearby places(within 3 miles). You can make use of printer as well. The wifi speed is awesome. The breakfast was good too. A lot of options to choose from scrambled eggs, yoghurt, fruits, waffles, oatmeal, corn flakes etc etc. Overall , I enjoyed my stay   here. Would love to come again.

We stayed here for 9 nights.  The breakfast every morning was fantastic.  Scrambled eggs, potatoes, either ham or sausage, waffles, cereal, oatmeal, bagels, English muffins, fruit, and a "special" such as sausage biscuits, French toast, etc.  Coffee, juices.   In the lobby was an infused water...everyday a different fruit infused in ice water.  Very refreshing.  Several nights during the week they had get togethers with food and wine and beer.    The staff was very friendly.  The front desk attendants were always smiling and willing to help with directions, advice for local eating places, etc.  The pool was very clean.  Towels were provided.  Wi Fi was not very strong by the pool, but otherwise it was a nice place to relax after a long day.  Our room was cleaned everyday.  Fresh

Summary Heading: Great Staff and not to far from Disney
Summary: My family (wife, 2 daughters and dog) had the opportunity to stay here twice once during some repairs to our home near by and once when we first moved to the area.  I will begin by saying that the staff was extremely helpful, during our first stay we had spend all day driving and arrived in the evening, they saw how tired we all looked, upgraded me to a two bedroom suite, and held some of their dinner food for us...who does that!???  The staff at this hotel that is who!  Our second stay was just as nice, they once again upgraded us to a two-bedroom suite, and this time we didn't sleep in so we were able to enjoy the the delicious breakfast.  The morning breakfast is one of the most varied that I have seen in any hotel.    Some perks of staying here are the proximity to downtown

Summary Heading: Worst residence inn I've been to!
Summary: Extremely late check in,they made us wait an extra 1.5 hour. Furniture was very old and the arm chair was chewed up. The room given didn't match the room description. The carpets were old and SMELLY. Rooms needs remodeling and renewing. The good thing was the breakfast,and the staff was very friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your recent experience at the Residence Inn Cypress Los Alamitos with us.  I apologize that your room was not ready promptly at 4pm, our check-in time.  Sometimes the larger suites require additional cleaning time which can result in the suites not being available as soon as we would like.  I am very sorry our current appearance was not what you had anticipated. We strive to maintain the highest standards, not only in service, but also with regards to maintaining the overall look and feel of the hotel. Unfortunately, this sometimes requires essential renovations in our guest areas.  As you noticed, we are currently about to undergo a major renovation of our entire hotel.  This is sure to provide a highly functional space and stylish décor that meet the modern needs of our valued guests, like you.   Although we fell short of meeting your expectations during your past stay, I hope you will consider Residence Inn Cypress Los Alamitos on your next visit to Los Alamitos so that we can better deliver upon the guest experience you deserve.

Summary Heading: Our Stay at Marriott Residence Inn Los Alamitos
Summary: There were a few bumps along the way but it pales in comparison to the beautiful 5 night stay at this lovely hotel. I want to thank the kind staff who always made us feel warm and welcome. I also want to personally thank the General Manager Lisa Lane for making sure our room was exactly what I had requested. Lisa was just amazing and goes out of her way to please the guests. Lisa, thank you for your kindness and making this stay with my son something we will never forget. The hotel is just beautiful. The rooms are a nice size, clean, furniture is lovely, beds are just so incredibly comfortable and the full, hot breakfast was just perfect before the start of a busy day. Disneyland is not far at all............just a 15 or 20 minute drive down Katella and Knott's Berry Farm was
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind comments regarding the hotel and staff.  I am delighted to hear that you had a wonderful stay with your son and that we exceeded your expectations in every way. We look forward to your next stay when you are in the Cypress area.

Summary Heading: Not bad just a bit far away from Disney
Summary: This hotel was ok but I would prefer to stay closer to Disneyland in Garden Grove. Rooms were clean and quiet. Separate kitchen/living area. If you don't mind having a bit of a drive then give it a go.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review the hotel.  Although we are located only 8 miles from Disneyland, we understand that it would be more convenient to be closer to Anaheim if that is your only destination while in Southern California.  You will be happy to know that Marriott is opening 2 new hotels in Anaheim in 2015. We hope you enjoyed your time at Disneyland.

Summary: This is a newer Residence Inn located next to the Los Alamitos Race Track. It's location allows for easy access to Disneyland, Knotts Berry Farm, Seal and Huntington Beaches and Long Beach Harbor. This is the second year we have visited this property. Each time was a week in length. The property is well maintained and I can not find any faults. The staff was pleasant. They have a generous Marriott style free breakfast and Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday various snacks/drinks/BBQ or food truck visit in the evening. The gym has weights, two treadmills, bike and elliptical trainer. I rarely encountered another person in the gym. I suspect most people started their day early to get a head start on tourist activities. Last year the adjacent race track was a source of numerous outdoor
Manager Response: Thank you for the nice review!  I'm glad to hear that you visit each year and that you enjoyed your stay.  We work closely with the Los Alamitos Race Track to keep the flies on their side of the fence.  Unfortunately last year was a bit more troublesome due to the addition of 300 new Thoroughbred stables.  We look forward to seeing you next year in our newly renovated hotel as of January 2016.

Summary Heading: Good place to stay for long beach if you have a car.
Summary: Very nice rooms with bed room and living area, and kitchen area. There is a horse track entrance a few hundred feet away. A little in price than downtown long beach especially when you take parking into account.  Rate $138. Public transportation to long beach is doable but tricky....it is a better location not catering well with the commoner. but once you get to Long Beach lots of transport. Many good restaurants within 5 minutes. I probably would stay here if I ever go back to that area.

Summary Heading: Choice place near the base and track
Summary: Great location near the race track and Joint Forces Training Base. Very professional staff and my room had LED lighting throughout and very intelligently designed lamps on the side tables.   Ice maker didn't work initially, but after finding the water supply had been turned off under the sink it worked much better.   Food/munchies, brats, beer (Shocktop!) & wine in the grill or kitchen area M-W.

We had a nice weekend stay while in town for a baseball tournament.  We arrived a little ahead of the check in but Anthony at the front desk let us eat lunch in the lobby and even provided ice for my son's shoulder!  Nice breakfast each morning.  The bed and the pullout couch were both comfortable.  The only recommendation I would make is to limit the hours on the "sport court" like the hours at the pool.  I didn't love waking up to a lot of loud little boys playing basketball on the court at 6:45 Saturday morning.

6 weeks stay, very enjoyable long stay..great staff always helpful. great for its price and close to shops.  they offer different activity's every day i.e free bbq or social night.  pool is decent size, breakfast is good. front counter and room service is great!  how ever a non stick fry pan would make this stay even more enjoyable. full size fridge, 2 burner, microwave, dishwasher.....bbq outside. outdoor alfresco area nearby pool.  keep up the god work

Stayed here to attend my nephew's graduation at Cal State Long Beach.  The rooms were clean and beds were very comfortable.  The free breakfast room is a little small but the food was good, with a lot of variety.  I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and will stay here again.

Summary Heading: Friendly - efficient staff made our stay a very positive expereince
Summary: General Manager, Lisa Lane, checked us in with efficiency since we had booked multiple rooms.  Merisa and her staff provided excellent breakfast fares with friendly smiles, and helpful when there was a need for some attention to some request.  Maria in housekeeping provided outstanding attention to the housekeeping of our rooms each day of our stay.  Check out was a breeze with the helpful assistance of Assistant General Manger, Karen Ochampaugh.  This is truly a first class operation.

Typical Residence In.. Could do with better employee training, not very friendly or accommodating.  Asked for bottle of water on check in, I'm a platinum member, told me I had to buy it. Got down to breakfast a little late, asked for Orange Juice, was told no, then offered.  Still would be a hotel I would stay at again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide the hotel with feedback regarding your stay. We appreciate your business and your loyalty to Marriott. As a Platinum Rewards Member, you always have a choice between 200 Reward Points or an item from the market. Your suggestion for a complimentary water at check-in is a great one, especially as the weather heats up! We look forward to you next stay in Cypress.

Summary Heading: Beautiful rooms that reminded me of an apartment
Summary: I've often stayed at a Marriott property because I'm a Honored Guest but this property is top of the line. The rooms are large and comfortable and look just like the photos. The breakfast covers two rooms downstairs with every imaginable food item you'd want. Delicious and cold when it was supposed to be, and warm ditto. I will return to this property next time in in CA on business again.

Had some business at Los Alamitos Joint Base, and stayed here for a week.  Front Desk and other staff were professional and courteous.  Suite was well-equipped and roomy, including kitchenette/microwave, fridge.  Breakfast was included that had lots of options.  A couple of nights a week, they offered a "mix" that ranged from a full meal (burgers) to dessert or others.  Clientele seemed to be mostly military/government due to the proximity of the base, with the occasional family taking advantage of its proximity to Disneyland.  Would stay again if I had reason to be in the area.

I was here for one night. Big room nice bed lighting and clean but a long walk from front desk. I had a good experience here overall. Heater was a bit loud but bearable. I found it better than the marriott courtyard on the same street. I appreciate the free popcorn as I got in late and the snack was perfect.

Summary Heading: Terrible stay but great customer service and follow up
Summary: We were in the area for a college event that was very important to our family. Unfortunately we did not have a good stay at this property, I am not going to go into details because I was able to speak with the manager who not only refunded our stay (yes, it was that terrible) but listened to my concerns and gave me valid reasons to believe she will work on these issues so they don't happen to anyone else. Therefore give this property poor instead of terrible, again the staff was very kind but not able to resolve issues which is why it escalated to management. I give the manager an excellent review for listening, not trying to defend the wrongs, and although that time and event can never take place again and there are no do overs, recognizing we should not have had to pay for the
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback regarding your stay at the hotel. I'm glad we were able to speak over the phone. I have spoken to my staff and we will ensure that our future guests will not encounter the same issues.  We are committed to providing an outstanding guest experience for all of our guests.

Summary Heading: Typical Residence Inn, but showing its age
Summary: Room an exact layout match for any other Residence Inn.  Long way from the check-in and breakfast areas.  In fact, you have to go outside the building to get to the breakfast area, good thing it doesn't rain in Southern California!  Room was fine except that the carpet had what surely looked like 10-12 burn holes in it, but this is a no smoking property, that is strange?  Chairs very worn at the arms, actually ripped.  This place really needs to be updated.  TV went up and down in sound for no reason.  Bed/bathroom area typically decent.  Breakfast had some strange items.  A giant bowl of yogurt instead of the little sealed cups everyone else had.  The yogurt in the big bowl didn't look appetizing at all.  Fruit bowl beside it looked like old tired fruit, not fresh at ll.
Manager Response: Thank you for providing feedback regarding your stay.  I am delighted to announce that a renovation is being planned for the end of 2015. I was sorry to learn that you did not enjoy the breakfast.  We do rotate items daily. I will be speaking to the kitchen team to ensure that all hot food remains hot throughout the breakfast hours. We appreciate your business and hope to see you again soon.

Summary: Received my bill for the evening at 4:00am checked in at 9:30 total price was 164.00 checked bank account noticed payment being taken out was 190.00 wasn't notified by desk personal about extra money being applied to bill call back in the morning for explanation received worse customer service ever from Matt and Regina also i'm a rewards member couldn't imagine going back there
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review the Residence Inn.  I was sorry to hear about your payment issue and the service you received when you requested an explanation. We take great pride in providing outstanding service so it is disappointing when we fail to deliver to our guests. In answer to your question regarding the payment, I believe that the $190 was the authorization held on your card. This amount is the room and tax plus approximately $30 for any incidentals that may be incurred. After checkout, any un-used amount is returned to your card. I apologize that this was not explained to you during your stay.

Summary: The hotel is next door to Los Alamitos horse racing track, but we never heard the noise and the track was in season. We stayed here for our soccer team tournament. If you are playing at the Long Beach "Beach Classic" at CSU Long Beach, it is about a 10-13 minute drive, in-land. No big deal of a drive. The hotel has a pool, and jacuzzi for the sore muscles. In the pool area there are patio tables and a lot of chairs. But the kicker is the large BBQ to cook up a big meal for the team and families;this is a very nice feature. The included breakfast is standard blah breakfast at a buffet, nothing wrong with cereal, toast and yogurt, just nothing tasty. But it will fill you up until you need to eat again. Next door is a center that has Subway. Staff was courteous, which is good since

The location of the Residence Inn is next to the entrance road to the quarter horse race track and about 2 stoplights up from the entrance road to JB Los Alamitos. There are any number of very good restaurants within the area around it on Katella. Just be advised you will need to do a U turn at the light where the track entrance is on Katella if you are coming from LAX to get to the hotel. The room that I had on the 2d floor was nice, not new, but nice, with a very comfortable bed. The shower pressure was only ok, but there was plenty of hot water. WiFi is free and had good strength. Very comfortable place to spend 4 nights. What I really liked about this hotel was the very well maintained courtyard with plants and flowers around the pool, which was a great place for sitting

Overall, I would return to this hotel.  With that being said, the rooms need some updating.  There were several items that were pretty worn (the couch cushion, the leather on the arm chair, the padding on the dinning chairs, the cabinets in the kitchen, etc.) or broken (some of the tile in the bathroom, the hair dryer).  The room was clean and usable so overall we were fine with the small issues.    We were here for a family vacation to Disneyland and ended up having an extra family member tag along.  I called the night before to see if we could upgrade to a two-bedroom instead of a one and they were sold out.  When we arrived about 10:00 AM (way before the 4:00 PM check-in time) I said we just wanted to inquire about a two-bedroom.  Melina at the front desk was so friendly and

Had to give this property a 2 only due to it's location only. Poor representation of Residence Inn. Worst is the ancient mattresses - old and broken down. The rooms are in a state of disrepair - cracked tiles, mold on vents, wallpaper bubbling off from mold. This property has embraced the idea of minimal spending on maintenance and evening food offering.  On average one skimpy meal per week and one "dessert" reception.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of the hotel. I am disappointed to hear that your room was in an unacceptable state. Our housekeeping and engineering staff strive each day to prepare perfect rooms for our guests. I will personally inspect our suites to find the issues that you have mentioned.  The Residence Inn Brand is updating our social event offerings at all Residence Inn hotels which will be called The Mix.. Beginning in April, each hotel will have a consistent program compared to all hotels. This will include a social event Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday. Based on considerable research, these events will focus more on the social experience which will include premium beverages. Each evening will be different. Some of the events offered are: Sip and Dip, BBQ, Dessert night, Food Trucks and Local Flavors (a local restaurant will bring in their most popular food items for our guests to try.) We look forward to your future visits to the area.

Summary: We spent a couple nights here at the end of the Cember 2014. This hotel is right next door to the street from the Los Alamitos racetrack and about 20 minutes drive from Disney.   We really like residence is because they include breakfast it was a good way to get our day started.   We can always find yogurt and fresh fruit and occasionally I'll throw a bagel or in English muffin in the toaster then and I'll load up the turkey sausage and some eggs and make a breakfast sandwich.   Great location for Disney and great value!

I always check the various Marriott brands first when I travel in the U. S. If the price is right and the location ideal for my purposes, I book straight away and am seldom disappointed. This was the case with this Residence Inn when I visited the area for a November reunion with long-time friends. It was convenient to/from a few L.A.-area interstates, had plenty of nearby dining options, and perfect hotel/room amenities. The only non-positive feedback I have is that the rooms are housed in two separate buildings that are connected to the main lobby and breakfast room only through outdoor walkways. It's really not a big deal except for a couple of chilly mornings and one that was rainy. All in all I had a very pleasant 3-night stay and can gladly to recommend.

We stayed here for work and plan on returning next time. Their amenities on site are great to include the pool, grill, exercise room, and lounge. Breakfast there is better than other places. The location offers numerous attractions and restaurants. Not far from the beach as well.

Very very nice stay for the price. Actual kitchen too.  Full breakfast (free) buffet  Free parking  Too bad booked for Christmas though Much better than Embassy suites  Cheaper than hilton Decent wifi speed too I like the separate building thing too

We stay at Marriotts where ever we can, because of the high standard, this was no exception, facilities were top class, swimming pool and sports court set in garden courtyard, BBQ available if you wanted. The room had seperate bedroom from lounge and small kitchen. Hot breakfast every morning was included. Many amenities around,shops, resaurants and places of interest. We only stayed 2 nights, but you could stay longer. All the staff were friendly and helpfull, I would recommend to anyone.

This was our second extended stay at the Residence Inn Cypress Los Alamitos.  First trip was great; this trip was greatermore.  Excellent front desk service from all of the staff, especially Javier and Matt.  The hotel, although near capacity was very quite.  The breakfasts were wonderful, as always.  At the top of our list, we love the location.  For us it is close to friends, family, business, and attractions.  It is a few miles from the nearest highway, so there is no busy traffic/congestion.  Looking forward to returning soon.

Booked this RI at the last minute for a weekend getaway & to spend time with family.  Friendly, helpful staff, nicely appointed rooms and a beautiful pool area in a tropical-like setting.  Would give this hotel 5 stars, except furniture was a little worn and furnishings felt dated.  But we'd definitely return.

Summary Heading: Residence Inn Cypress - Home Away from Home
Summary: From the moment you enter the lobby area, you will feel right at home.  The staff is very accommodating, and your check in will be fast and efficient, so that you can quickly settle into your room.  I interacted mainly with Char upon arrival and departure.  I observed that she goes out of her way to make sure that the customers are well treated.  The room I stayed in was immaculate, and I found the furnishings to be nice and comfy.   When you stay at this Residence Inn, you won't have to worry about having all of the necessary supplies available for you to use.  For example, if you need a towel or some dishwsher soap you won't need to search or call room service.    I needed a quiet place to rest, and I couldn't believe how nice and peaceful my room was.   The complimentary

We stay at this property frequently when we visit our daughter and her family in Long Beach.  We just returned from 2 nights there and everything was just fine.  Only once in the probably 6 years we have been going there, have we had to change rooms due to a bad mattress.  The best thing about it for me, is the spaciousness and the quiet.  My husband likes the breakfast quite a bit. I usually get the oatmeal or fix a bagel.  Now that we are "seniors" the rate is pretty darn good.  I wouldn't keep going back if I'd had a bad experience.  I use the workout room when I'm being energetic,and it's usually vacant.  Small though. Nice kitchenette, but we don't use it except for coffee.

Stayed in a two bedroom suite which was perfect for us clean and comfortable. I travel frequently and have never encountered a team of staff like they have here-so polite, kind friendly any issues resolved immeaditely. We're made to feel most welcome and at home. It was really nice to see the manager a lovely lady mingling with guests at the BBQ night at which she was doing the cooking-most impressive.  Thank you all for making our stay a wonderful memory! I highly recommend this property

Summary Heading: Avoid, health hazard (for now at least)
Summary: I hate to give it a poor review, because it's really a good hotel in general.   But, it's filled and surrounded by flies, which makes the hotel a health concern for the people staying there.   I never seen this ugly scene before in Orange County, so it's really weird.   The only explanation might be the horse track or club behind them.   But anyways they are suppose to deal with it instead of leaving this ugly health hazard like that.   Avoid til they fix this issue.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts regarding this issue. We appreciate your understanding. It has definitely been a struggle this year, more than any year in the past. I do want to assure you that we have a plan in place to reduce the volume of flies at the hotel. I can confidently say, that we have the situation under control as I write this. We are working closely with the race track, who is trying to be a good neighbor. They are spraying their land and ours every day. In addition, we are utilizing our pest elimination vendor every week to provide support. We will continue to fight the flies every day to make sure that our guests have an enjoyable experience and can comfortably use every area of the hotel. We look forward to seeing you the next time you are in the area!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay in Los Alamitos
Summary: I stayed here for a business trip and it was very comfortable.  I had a nice large room with a fireplace and a kitchen.  It was comfortable and spacious and recently updated. I had no trouble getting an internet connection from the room.  The room was clean and had a full kitchen if you wanted to cook.  Staff at the front desk were very friendly.  The hotel had a couple of social hours which were nice after work including a sip and dip pool party.  This hotel is close to a number of restaurants.  They had a free breakfast in the morning with hot food which was great.  I would definetly stay here again if I was in the area.  A bonus was being able to see the track from my window.  It was fun to watch them exercise the horses in the morning.  You are almost right next door to Los

We booked this room last minute for a quick get away. The price was good and location perfect. The rooms are clean and plenty of room. They have kitchen and living room. The pool was fun for kiddo. Seemed like nice people staying her. Grounds are nice and well keep.

I booked a block of rooms for several families. From the moment I contacted the staff at this hotel they were courteous and thorough. Upon check in they were friendly- even offering up several options for nearby restaurants and directions to my nearest bank. Our room was clean- nice and very comfortable. The rooms felt updated and we were very happy.  The included breakfast was fully stocked and delicious. Pool area and hotel grounds were very clean and as we were there we saw many staff members walk through to check on the area. We will most definately return to this hotel. Thank you for the great stay!
Manager Response: Thank you for the terrific review!  It was our pleasure to serve you and your family during your visit to the area.

Summary Heading: Good hotel with one glaring (make that buzzing) problem
Summary: The hotel property is very nice, the staff were excellent, the pool, work area, etc. all good. So what was the problem you ask...Flies. Everywhere. Outside by the pool, inside the lobby and in the breakfast area. Not in our room, thank goodness, but everywhere else.  I guess being next to the Los Alamitos Horse Racing Track is the source of this problem but it needs to be fixed. Either install some blowers above the doors like they use in hospitals and other buildings or put up some fly traps because it was bad.  Fix this issue and the rating goes way up.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for the outstanding comments regarding the staff and hotel. We appreciate your comments regarding the flies as well. The summer of 2014 has been a difficult year for flies and as you mentioned, the souce is the Los Alamitos Race Track.  We are partnering with both the Race Track as well as our own pest control vendor to reduce the volume of flies and are confident that we will be able to solve this issue quickly. We look forward to your next visit!
