Summary: This hotel, like other residence inn, has nice amenities for long term stay.  It has a kitchen, fridge, table wear etc.  The room is good size.  Hotel has free wifi and coin operated laundry room.  The place is clean and comfortable.  There are many restaurants that is close by.  If I come visit here, I would be willing to stay here again.  The only thing I wish it's better is the free breakfast.  Maybe it's b/c of the days we were there, server can't keep up with food in the buffet line.  Also the food is just so so.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of the hotel and amenities. The Residence Inn brand is purpose built for the extended stay traveler who is away from home. I was sorry to hear that you did not enjoy your breakfast experience. The staff works very hard to keep up with the flow of guests during the busy summer months and will continue to strive for excellence in this area.

Summary: My family and I have been staying at this property for over 8 years, sometimes several times per year.  Lisa Lane, GM, has an amazing team, from front desk, food service and housekeeping.  Lisa and her team are always smiling, happy to help and go above and beyond with any and all guests requests.  They are all hands on and provide exceptional guest satisfaction.  The hotel is clean, inside and out.  They are located close to Disneyland and Knott’s Berry Farm, and our family enjoys the spacious suites with full kitchens and the complimentary hot breakfast buffet every morning.  Stop by and enjoy their evening happy hour and get to meet their staff.  Thumbs up to Lisa and her team.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to write a review on the hotel. We are delighted to host you and your family every year and look forward to many years to come!

Summary Heading: Five friends one suite no problems!
Summary: We stayed 5 people in a 2-bedroom suite for five nights, and that worked out really well. Comfortably-sized suite with everything, two bathrooms, pull-out sofa bed, etc. The suite was clean and presentable, and the furniture didn't look too old. Pool area was really nice, and the service was good.  The breakfast was ok but not great, there could have been a few more healthy options.  Only real complaint was the wifi - in some parts of our suite there was almost no connection at all. Also, the pillows were a little high.
Manager Response: Thank you for reviewing the hotel. We appreciate the feedback and are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your experience. You will be happy to hear that we will be upgrading the internet this year in two phases to include a premium internet option as well as additional speed and connectivity. We are interested to learn of any other healthy options that we could provide on the breakfast. Our current healthier options include fresh fruit, yogurt, oatmeal and boiled eggs. We look forward to your next stay!

Summary Heading: This hotel is well within the city limits of Los Alamitos, California
Summary: The title of this review is important - because one of the recurring themes is that the hotel takes a photocopy of the guest's ID (please note my 170+ reviews, and even I find this odd in a US hotel, more common in foreign hotels where a copy of one's passport is the norm). Then, the GM goes on to mention in responses, as well as a large sign on the front desk citing a City of Cypress Municipal Code. That is not at all relevant since the city limit for the city of Cypress is at least three blocks away on the east side of the race track, any more than it would be relevant to cite a Long Beach municipal code, a few blocks to the west. I complied with their request since I arrived late in the evening (early in the AM, really), but would have otherwise taken issue with it. That bit
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback regarding the Residence Inn by Marriott Cypress Los Alamitos.  I understand there is confusion because of our name and zip code. The hotel is physically located in the City of Cypress, but has a Los Alamitos zip code due to zoning created many years ago.  Because of this we include both Cypress and Los Alamitos in the name of the hotel. We are currently complying with the ordinance mandated by the city of Cypress, which does require a validation of guest information from driver’s license or other valid ID.  I certainly understand your concerns with sharing this personal information and I will express your feedback to our city officials. If you have any additional questions regarding our location, please contact me at (714) 761-6707.

Summary: I was traveling here for business for 2 weeks.  I arrive and check in.  The staff at the front desk took my state ID and made a copy.  They gave me my room number and directions to my room.  I arrive to my room with bags in hand to find out the room is already occupied.  I was startled to see items in the room I was assigned too.  I used the house phone and called the front desk.  They thought I was complaining that the room was dirty so a staff member came up and entered the room himself.  He indicated he was "so sorry" for the mistake.  They gave me another room.  I enter this room and all seems well.............but this room had an ant infestation.  So after I had unpacked all my things I find ants.  I called down to the front desk again.  The young lady offered me a
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review the hotel. I am disappointed to hear that you were unhappy and that we did not provide you with the outstanding experience that you expect and deserve. As a member of the Cypress business community, we are required to follow the laws of the city. One of those laws, is Cypress Municipal Code 3.17.130 which states that "inn keepers are required to obtain a copy of state issued identification from each registered guest." I apologize for the error at check-in with your suite. Unfortunately, one of our associates mistakenly did not fully check in the previous guest into the computer at their arrival which resulted in the room being already occupied when you arrived. Rest assured that this was a one time error that will not happen again. We also had unseasonably warm weather in May, which resulted in the ants in your room. We have discussed this issue with our pest elimination company to ensure that we do not have any further occurences. Thank you for your comments regarding the food and beverage at the hotel. We are in the process of testing new evening events for our guests on behalf of Marriott and appreciate your feedback. If you would like to discuss anything further, please contact me at (714) 484-5700 ext 600. I would love to have the opportunity to win your business back.

Summary: Always try and stay in a Residence Inn during business travel.  I like the rooms and the service. The price is a bit high for my pleasure travel (cheap) but if someone else is paying why not! Over the past few years, the evening reception (The mix) has been cut way back.  Last evening I found out that "the mix" was - go out and order a pizza from a food truck. This would not be so bad if I didn't have to pay for it (cheap).   They call it "local flavor".  I call it - another way for Marriott way to cut costs.  It use to be that the evening reception was every day of the week, not includeing sat and sun.  Now they pick and chose 3 days of the week and throw in the food truck one of those day. Good luck if you pick one of those days if you get actual food and drink provided by the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide your feedback regarding our hotel.  We are very glad to hear that you like our suites and the service provided by our team and greatly appreciate your honest input on our evening social.  Based on feedback from previous guests, the Residence Inn brand is currently exploring new opportunities to refresh our evening social program, and we are one of the hotels in a pilot that just began this Spring.  Customer feedback indicated that guests are looking for experiences that help connect with each other and our local area.  With food trucks being a major food trend, inviting one to our hotel a couple of times a month is a new approach we are testing.  Our goal with the new program is to deliver fun and relaxing events, not to compromise the satisfaction of our valued guests.  We will certainly take your viewpoint into consideration as we design the new evening program and look to update other amenities.

Summary: We stayed here for one night in a two bedroom/two bathroom suite and it was perfect for us. The hotel is located in a nice quiet area with plenty of restaurants and stores in the area. Short drive to the freeway. The staff was really nice, even gave me cookies upon check-in. I felt safe leaving my car in the parking lot. The free breakfast was a big plus! And they offer free Wi-Fi!  As for cons -  the toiletry items in one of the bathrooms were not replaced, they were all opened and used from the previous guest, and one of the hand towels was very old and had a ripped in it.. The sofa bed was very uncomfortable but the beds in the rooms were fine.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback regarding your stay. We appreciate the comments regarding our awesome staff!  I have discussed your comments regarding the amenities with our housekeeping staff to ensure that these errors do not occur again. We are also in the process of replacing all of the sofabed mattresses to ensure a comfortable night in every bed in the room.We look forward to seeing you next time!

Summary: We stayed at the Residence Inn Cypress Los Alamitos from April 19-25th.  We stay here with some frequency as our kids/grandkids live nearby.  The rooms are up-to-date, clean, and comfortable.  The pool area was pleasant and the pool water clean (although it could be a bit warmer).  Our grandchildren love spending time in the pool.  Actually, they love coming to the hotel in general.  We had them spend the night one night.  We used the pull out sofa bed, which was clean and comfortable for both of them (they're small).    The staff is one of the highlights of this hotel.  Very friendly and helpful.  The applies from the desk clerks to the housekeeping staff to the breakfast staff.  Terrific!
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful note regarding the hotel and the staff.  We are delighted to host you and your grandchildren whenever you are in the area.  I will check on the pool temperature to make sure it is at the correct temperature of 80 degrees so it will be perfect for your next stay! See you soon!

Summary: We arrived very early because we needed to check-in before a late afternoon appointment.  At the front desk, Matt was very helpful and did everything he could to accommodate our needs.  During the duration of our stay, 7 nights, we found the front desk staff to be very courteous, helpful, and cheerful.  Our first night the bed was horrible.  Collapsed in the middle.  We reported this to the desk and it was fixed immediately.  Went from worst bed ever to one of the best!  Breakfast was exactly as we hoped.  I love RI breakfasts for the food quality and selection options.  The kitchen staff worked diligently to keep the items full and fresh.  The location was great for us.  As mentioned by other reviewers, this hotel is in a neighborhood, not next to a freeway.  Access to the 605,
Manager Response: Thank you for the outstanding review of the hotel.  We appreciate your feedback. I'm delighted to hear that we were able to resolve the mattress issue for you so quickly. We are planning to replace all of the mattresses in 2014, so our guests will never experience a poor sleeping experience. We look forward to your next stay.

Summary Heading: Great property and I couldn't have ask it any better!
Summary: This property was so amazing that I came back twice! I was here couple days for work and I couldn't have asked for more. Everyone went out there way to help you. The checkin process for fairly quick, the room was quiet ( no matter what floor you were on) I stayed on the 4th floor the first couple nights and had asked to be on the ground floor for the last night since I was having a small gathering with friends and they had a great grill setup near my room. I stayed on 1/1/14 and Paul and the other gal ( I wished I remembered her name) was awesome! They went out their way to get me everything I needed to get the grill started. Their friendliness will make me want to come back for more and to top it off, they have a 24 hour fitness sport right next to the hotel! This was a bonus
Manager Response: Thank you for your great comments on the hotel and staff! The patio and BBQ area are open to our guests and are busy year round due to the wonderful California climate. We are happy that you were able to enjoy the area with your friends. The 24 Hour Fitness next door is a great partner to the hotel. The next time you are at the hotel, ask the front desk for discounted admission on day and month passes.  Thank you!

Summary: Stayed here in lieu of an unsafe/dumpy "hotel area" while visiting friends who live in Pasadena.  Safe, clean area.  We travel with dogs and found the hotel hospitable for dogs with grass area to do their business.  Hotel has indoor hallways, was quiet, nice clean kitchen w/full frige, pull-out sofa and bedroom.  Breakfast was decent.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing the Residence Inn by Marriott Cypress Los Alamitos!  We appreciate your business.  As a pet friendly hotel, it is important to us to provide nice areas for the pets as well. We look forward to your return!

Summary: We picked this particular Residence Inn because of its location -- midway between a number of family and friends that we planned to visit. The location turned out to be perfect for us and the hotel is located in a very quiet neighborhood. Additionally there are a number of decent restaurants nearby. The property is very clean, the service excellent, the breakfast buffet met expectations and our one bedroom suite was just fine. Will happily return next time we are in the area.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your kind comments. One of the hotel's best features is that we are centrally located in the Los Angeles/Orange County area.  We look forward to seeing you the next time you are in the area!

Summary Heading: Clean rooms, but cost cutting on the extras
Summary: Stayed here for 15 days in August.  The service was great.  The rooms were clean and spacious.  The hotel layout was nice and the central courtyard and pool area was a pleasant place to relax.  Housekeeping did a fantastic job.  My room was always clean and fresh when I returned from work each evening.   My one complaint would be with the very low quality of the food in the hotel.  They advertise a daily breakfast buffet and a manager's reception Mon-Wed evening.  While the service at both events was friendly and efficient, you could tell the food quality was really cheap.  I feel kind of funny complaining about the quality of free food (you get what you pay for I guess...), but the powdery-tasting eggs and wonderbread hot-dog buns left a cheap aftertaste to an otherwise
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding the cleanliness of the hotel and the staff service. My team is delighted that you enjoyed your extended stay with us. I am sorry to hear that you did not enjoy the complimentary breakfast and social hour. The hotel does utilize Pappetti's Liquid Eggs for the scrambled eggs and Hilltop Hearth for the Hot Dog Buns per the Marriott standard for food and beverage supplies. We do serve a variety of meals for the social hour and are testing new items that will appeal to our guests. We appreciate your business are always interested in ideas for improvement.  Thank you!

Summary Heading: Excellent Stay!!!   Wonderful choice for anyone.
Summary: We stayed here over the last weekend and it was a very nice stay.  After viewing some of the negative reviews we were a little skeptical, however this Residence Inn was absolutely fantastic.  The room was beautiful, very large in size for a queen studio.  The free internet and wireless worked well.  The breakfasts were amazing with great choices and the food extremely fresh and never ran low.  Fresh fruit was plentiful and the coffee always fresh.  The staff was great and very professional and personable.  We would highly recommend this RI and liked that it was in a quiet and safe location.  We would return in a heartbeat and most likely will.  We traveled to Huntington Beach and Anaheim (Honda Center) during our stay without a problem and each request was handled by staff
Manager Response: Thank you for your high praise for the hotel!  It is our mission that every guest enjoy every day, every stay. It is great to hear that we have succeeded. We look forward to your return!

Summary Heading: Not up to other RI standards
Summary: We are lifetime Marriott Platinum Premier members and  fans of Marriott properties and the Residence Inn concept. It is very rare that we are dissatisfied with a RI but were totally disappointed by this stay. We felt as though we were distrusted during our entire visit which we ended up cutting short.  The feeling begins at check in when you must provide a copy of your driver's license .We were informed that it is a local ordinance but it made me uneasy.We never had to provide this level of personal information to a hotel since they have our entire profile on file. During the evening social I requested a little milk for my coffee instead of cream and was told by the hostess that I needed to make the request at the front desk. I thought this was odd but made my request at the
Manager Response: Thank you for staying at the Residence Inn Cypress Los Alamitos, and for your longtime loyalty to Marriott hotels.  I regret to hear that you had an unfortunate experience.  As a member of the Cypress business community, we are required to follow the laws of the city. One of those laws, is Cypress Municipal Code 3.17.130 which states that "inn keepers are required to obtain a copy of state issued identification from each registered guest."  I understand why this could have made you feel uneasy, but please rest assured that we were simply trying to abide by the laws of the city.  Our intention was never to make you feel distrusted. Thank you for your comments regarding the supplies of the hotel.  In each suite, there should always be an extra roll of toilet paper and an extra box of tissues under the sink.  I apologize that these were missing when you needed them.  The hotel does offer complimentary breakfast each day as well as the social hour Monday - Wednesday. We have many options available and rotate those options on a seasonal and weekly basis.  Milk should be available at both events without a fee. I apologize that you were charged for this.  We do have a few security protocals in place to ensure that each guest has everything they need to enjoy their stay, and that those items remain available for future guests.  We have taken your comments to heart.  They will help us to reenergize our team to ensure that we do not carry out procedures in a way that makes our guests feel distrusted. Please contact me directly at (714) 761-5700 if you would like to discuss any part of your experience in more detail.  Thank you again for your loyalty to Marriott hotels.

Summary: Stayed here for one night as an alternate to my usual hotel in the area. Pretty good experience and I would probably stay again. Lobby staff was welcoming. Very disappointing breakfast could seriously be better - I will skip it next time. Room was clean and comfortable.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. I appreciate your comments regarding our wonderful staff.  I would welcome the opportunity to learn more about what offerings you would like to see at our complimentary daily hot breakfast buffet.  We currently offer daily scrambled eggs, breakfast potatos, sausage or turkey canadian bacon, make your own waffles, hot and cold cereal, yogurt parfaits, breakfast breads such as wheat bread, bagels and english muffins and fresh fruit. In addition, we rotate items such as breakfast burritos, egg and sausage sandwiches, french toast and pancakes.  Please contact me directly at (714) 484-5700 to advise me of other options.   Thank you,

Summary Heading: A Great Stay With My Husband & Cats!
Summary: While our residence was being fumigated for termites, my husband and I, along with our 2 cats, stayed for four nights at this location. We really enjoyed our stay for the most part. It was a nice sized mini-suite and a good price.  It was nice that for a small fee, we were able to stay with our cats instead of needing to board them.   We loved having the complimentary breakfast that was included. Both of have traveled for business before and we were both very happy with the freshness and variety of food choices that there were each morning.  The only thing that was lacking was the bed. It was slightly small to us, but we are used to a California King sized bed. This was okay, but not particularly comfortable. Other than that, everything was great.  We are looking forward to the
Manager Response: I am delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us (and your cats too!) Unfortunately, we do not offer king size beds at this time.  Most of the suites, while twice the size of a normal hotel room, simply do not offer the square footage required for a king sized bed. We are looking into upgrading to king beds in our corner rooms during our next renovation.  Thank you for the feedback!

Summary: For our 2013 family vacation we spent six nights in Southern California and stayed at the Residence Inn on Katella.   Our itinerary for this trip had us all over the place with stops to the north in Santa Monica and Downtown LA. A visit to Disney which is a short 10 minute drive from the hotel. And finally a trip south to Legoland which is almost in San Diego. Because of our busy schedule we went with a hotel fairly centrally located to all our stops but still close to Disney as we knew the Disney days would be long so we wanted to keep the travel time down to a minimum on those days. The area around the hotel seemed pretty nice with a number of good restaurants. It does get a little sketchy closer to Disney but this location was far enough away.   We have become loyal Residence
Manager Response: Thank you for your loyalty to Residence Inn. I am happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay and were able to take advantage or our great location to visit many of the areas that Southern California has to offer.  We did close the pool for a few days for maintenance before the summer months and have completely resurfaced the spa.  Thank you for your comment regarding the door latch height. I will review that with my maintenance staff. Thank you,

Summary Heading: The Hotel was excellent but one of the front desk person was'nt too pleasant.
Summary: My dad was celebrating his 80th birthday so we came all the way from Florida. The Check in went smooth and the young lady was very helpful and pleasant. The breakfast was awesome and room was very clean and our housekeeper was great. The only thing that left a bad taste in my mouth was when my sister came in the next day and the front desk host Kelly was rude. Maybe she was having a bad day but she was not very professional. So instead of a 4 or even a 5 i rated this hotel a 3.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your comments about the Residence Inn Cypress from your visit. We enjoy helping our guests celebrate big occasions.  I am very sorry to hear your comments regarding the front desk associate. As a Marriott hotel, we conduct extensive service training with each associate to ensure that our guests enjoy their stay in every way.  It sounds like this standard was not met in this situation and I apologize.  Training is an on-going process and we will continue to work with our associates to make sure our service is "top notch" every time. Thank you,

Summary: This hotel is very convenient for business travel due to the location.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  There wasn't a true "business center" but I was able to use what they did have to meet business needs.  The bathroom wasn't the cleanest and I am not sure the room was cleaned daily but it wasn't bad.  Parking can be sparse but nothing extreme.  The hotel is very good over all.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of the Residence Inn Cypress Los Alamitos. As you mentioned, the hotel is conveniently located and is also centrally situated in the Cypress Business Park as well as close to both Disneyland and the Long Beach area. Our business center offers two desktop computers with a printer. We also have copying and fax service available at the front desk. For any additional needs, the hotel is located next door to an Office Depot which does offer many business services.  The Housekeeping Staff does clean each room thoroughly every day. I apologize that you felt the bathroom was not up to standard. As a team, we will focus our efforts on maintaining excellent cleanliness in the entire suite and especially the bathroom.  Thank you,

Summary: 3/31/13 One Bedroom w/ sofa Bed w/ kitchen .Sofa bed was distressed with coils through out ,nu-bearable to sleep on. We were relocated to a 2 BD Room, sofa bed in 2 BD same condition as 1 BD Room, up grade fee $50 per night with 2 more nights reserved. AM Monday 4/1/13 spoke with front desk to confirm $100 up-grade fee. I was told $50 plus purchase of 15000 MR points .per night. I have been a Marriott Reward Member 20 years . At check out rate would have been $400 additional. All exceptionable, I decided to relocate advised Front Desk Assistant Manager that I was working on a re-solve, and was going to once again pack. Her response to me was "CHECK OUT IS AT NOON, BE OFF THE PROPERTY OR I WILL CALL THE POLICE !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Re cap MR Member 20 yrs, 1/2 Million spent through
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your comments about your recent stay with us.  I'm glad to hear that you found the hotel to be clean, and that the majority of your interactions with my staff were friendly and helpful.  I hope that you made some wonderful memories with your grandchildren while at Disney Land.  The other experiences during your stay sound frustrating.  Please accept my apologies for any inconveniences.  We are so grateful for our Marriott Reward members.  Thank you for your business and loyalty over the years.    At Marriott International our first priority is always the comfort, care and safety of our guests.  I would appreciate the opportunity to discuss the details of your stay personally.  I hope to restore your confidence in the Marriott family of hotels.  Please contact me directly at (714) 761-6707.  Thank you again.  Lisa Lane General Manager Residence Inn by Marriott Cypress Los Alamitos

Summary: The hotel is nice, but completely disappointing. Stayed here while attending a conference in Anaheim for several days/nights. We arrived at 3:15 on Thursday. When I walked up to the front desk no one seemed to care that I was there. Once someone acknowledged my presence I was told that there were no rooms available despite there being a 3 PM check-in. I understand, but you are a corporate focused property, have the rooms available when the guest arrives. Fortunately I had to go to Anaheim and drop off an item which I knew would take about an hour. The front desk clerk told me she would upgrade the room for my trouble and she would call me to let me know the room was ready.  I returned about about 5 PM, not knowing if there would be a room for me. The front desk crew had changed
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us, and for sharing your comments about your experience.  I regretted to hear about the service you received during check-in.  I’ve shared your comments with my front desk team to improve our operations.  We used your scenario as a training exercise to ensure a warm welcome experience and better communication during shift changes.    I apologize that we did not have a room ready for you when you arrived.  Please note that our check-in time is actually 4 pm.  Since all of our rooms are suites with full kitchens they can take slightly longer to clean.  We always do our very best to accommodate early check-ins, but based on our occupancy the night before it isn’t always possible.We are gradually working on replacing appliances with the new stainless steel models so that the entire hotel does not have to wait until 2015 when we have our next renovation.  Currently, the 3rd and 4th floor one bedroom suites in our larger building have the new appliances.  More will be completed soon.    Our one bedroom suites actually have the exact the same square footage as our studio suites, but they look smaller to some guests because our one bedroom suites have a wall that divides the room.  It sounds like you were upgraded to a one bedroom suite but were moved to a studio suite with a fireplace.Unfortunately, the square footage of our suites do not support king size beds.  The only suites that could potentially fit a king are our corner studios. This is something I hope to convince our owners to include in our next renovation. Lastly, we did experience some issues with our door lock system while we were going through a software upgrade.  The upgrade was designed to increase the safety of the door lock.  Those issues have now been resolved.  I apologize for the inconvenience this caused.  It must have been frustrating.    If you’d like to discuss your stay in more detail please contact me directly at (714) 761-6707.  Thank you again for your comments.   Lisa Lane General Manager Residence Inn by Marriott Cypress Los Alamitos

Summary Heading: It was a great place to stay
Summary: This hotel has nice sized rooms, great staff, basketball/tennis court, awesome location and just a nice place to stay. The reviews for this hotel were spot on.The breakfast is done well and has a good selection of things to eat.

We stayed at this hotel after flying in from Texas for a California Visit. The person at the front desk was very welcoming and took time to explain what was available to us. Our room was clean and well taken care of. Our bed, although just a queen worked fine and was comfortable as well. This hotel was not a luxury spot, not intended for anyone to think it would be, but it worked fine for us and we felt safe and comfortable.

Summary Heading: Seems like a homeless shelter lately.
Summary: I have stayed here several times.  Recently, it seem that the state or county is using this hotel to house people long term.  This has included several people that seem less than savory, including the police and undercover officers staking out the place to look for one particular individual who is still staying in the hotel.    I have heard fighting and loud noises all throughout the day and all hours of the night.  It seems more like a Motel 6 lately.
Manager Response: Thank you for selecting our hotel so frequently.  We’re grateful for your continued business and for your comments.    We feel it’s important to clarify that the state/county does not place guests with us.  Insurance companies do and the homeowners are not always business people.  They are families whose homes have been damaged due to fire or floods.  At Marriott International we inclusively welcome all guests, and we take pride in being able to provide comfort and shelter for families during such a great time of need.      The safety of our guests is our number one priority.  While we are not able to comment on specific details about the police situation you’ve referenced we can share that this was a matter of mistaken identity, and that our guests were never in any danger.    Lastly, we regret to hear that you were disrupted by noise.   If you ever experience any out of the ordinary loud noises, regardless of the time of day, please report it to our front desk so we can address the situation.  We employee staff 24 hours a day to ensure that our guests enjoy the best stay.    Please contact me directly at (714) 761-6707 if you’d like to discuss your stay in more detail.   Lisa Lane General Manager

Summary: Typically nice clean Residence Inn room.  Located directly in front of horse track for those that may wish to go over, but still very quiet.  The desk and breakfast area staff were nothing short of outstanding.  Breakfast itself was well stocked and fairly diverse.  Easy to find on Katella.  We stayed here and visited Disneyland a couple days.  15/20 minute drive on surface streets.  VERY simple directions between the two places.  Easy drive over to the beach as well.

Stayed at this location for a family vacation, we had a two bedroom suite for a week and we where comfortable. Good location for trips to LA and Orange County, even San Diego is not a long drive. Rooms are clean and up to date, lots of restaurants around.

Summary Heading: very satisfied-close to Los Alamitos Race Track
Summary: We travelled to Los Alamitos to visit the Los Alamitos Race Track and stayed in a one bedroom. This hotel is the closest to the track. We were happily greeted and checked in promptly. The rooms are newly updated and not worn at all...smelled good, carpets clean, bed was comfy, kitchen was fully equipped (except oven of course), small dinette and small sitting area etc. Their breakfast was great and had a huge selection...scrambled eggs, sausage, French toast, waffles, oatmeal, fresh fruit, bagels, English muffins, other breads, muffins, yogurt, cereals,  juices, milks, coffee, tea etc. Definitely something for everyone. The only downside I can see about this hotel is the location to restaurants within walking distance...there aren't any other than a couple of fast food places.

Summary Heading: Good Location, Good Choice for Business Travel
Summary: This is where we stay when we're in the Orange County/LA area. Clean, quiet, showing some wear but well maintained, staffed by cordial employees. I'd do something about the flies in the dining area. On that subject, I know the breakfast and other food comes with the room, but those tables don't wipe themselves. Think about leaving a buck or two on the table for the folks who work for you.

Our family recently relocated to the California area, we needed a place to stay temporarily while we searched for a house.  Our children were starting school, my husband and I were both working and needed space within our room for computers, printing and ability to handle daily tasks. It could have been a stressful transition - however the hotel accommodations have been superior.  The room has an excellent layout that is very efficient, we have 2 bedrooms, full kitchen, living room, small dining area - it truly is all we need at the moment.  The staff is conscientious, caring, and greets you with a smile on a regular basis.  The amenities are perfect - a nice area for outdoor grilling and dining, basketball and tennis courts, pool, fitness center and warm breakfast each morning.

We would never have stayed here, were it not for the (hilarious) Wiener Nationals at the Los Alamitos Race Course next door, but we're glad we did! We booked a 2 bedroom suite for under $200, and it was HUGE. Two nice-sized onsuite bedrooms, each with a very comfortable queen bed, a living space with TV and fireplace, and a kitchen with a table for 4. Everything was very bright & clean, and all staff members were extremely friendly & helpful. Included was a decent breakfast buffet, and I loved the fact that they have a "store" beside the front desk where you can purchase snacks, water, etc., at any hour. If we ever go to Disneyland or the race track again, we will definitely be staying here!
Traveled out here for business. Residence inn has a great location. The bed's are very very comfortable and I slept great. The rooms are quiet and sound proof. Great place to stay.

Summary Heading: Second Stay - Just as Perfect as The First!
Summary: This is now my second stay at this location. I decided to return after an AWESOME first stay. I cannot say anything negative about this hotel, location and staff. Room (King Suite) was spacious, clean, and comfortable. I fear bed-bugs therefore I always check and Lysol things before I unpack and settle in. The room was already VERY clean and NO signs of ANY unwanted critters. LOVE the hot & filling breakfast served every morning and the ladies that manage that area should really be commended for keeping everything so clean, fresh and filled! The hotel grounds as kept so polished, the staff so friendly and willing to help, etc. I am so glad that I have found this gem of a hotel in Los Alamitos. Everytime I return to Long Beach, this will be my go-to place to stay...Period!

I was very pleased with the Residence Inn in Los Alamitos! I stayed in the 2BDR Suite. It has two master suites and a huge living area, comfortable beds and a great complimentary breakfast. The staff is tremendous and very accomodating. Did I mention the breakfast?! Awesome :)

Great stay and perfect location.  Located on Katella, close to Los Alamitos Blvd, which heading west, will turn into Seal Beach Blvd and take you to the 405.  In the other direction, close to Disney and Knott's Berry Farm for amusement parks.  Had a two bedroom suite which provide ample room for us and we always like having the full kitchen.  Breakfast in the morning was great and the staff kept everything well stocked.  Hot foods, waffles, real oatmeal, fruit, pasties, cereal...all you would want.    There are two separate buildings and each require key card for access and extra security.  We did not notice any problems with noise....which was a concern since there was a soccer tournament in town and the place was booked with soccer kids.    Would stay again for sure!
Perhaps almost too friendly.  The hand-written welcome note was a little over the top.  Well-kept property as well.  Hit the Katella Deli if you stay there.

Summary Heading: Just an average place, good price, close to disneyland!
Summary: the good: breakfast, the short drive to disneyland, two rooms in one suite was good for grandma and kid  The bad: the beds and pillows were very uncomfortable, the rooms appeared to be clean however not good regular cleaning (washrooms were just tidied up daily not really scrubed.  This location was close to disney but very far from LA (~1 hour) and other nice places.    probably wouldn't stay here again, wasn't impressed at the cleanliness.  No bugs that I noticed which is a plus! They make you sign a waiver for not making any noise and if so they will ask you to leave... my 4 year old jumped around for a min. before her dad asked her to stop...we got a call immediately that there were complaints.   Meanwhile, the suite next to us had a dog that barked all night for 7 days... :
They had baby roaches, climbing up the wall, in my granddaughters drink, walking on table.  Needless to say we checked out right away.  Screaming and hollering.
Manager Response: Dear 1stdiva – While I appreciate you sharing your experience on TripAdvisor, let me reiterate to you how unusual this type of event is at our hotel. After you alerted my staff of the situation, we immediately contacted our regular pest elimination company to come in and rid the hotel of any remaining critters and they assure us that we are now completely pest free. Our follow-up discussion led me to believe you had been fairly compensated for your troubles when we not only compensated you for two nights at another hotel of your choosing, but also adding an additional 5000 Marriott Reward points to your account and made sure all credit card holds were removed. In addition, I hope that you and your family enjoyed the Edible Arrangement that I had sent to your hotel. However, should you feel there is anything further to discuss, please feel free to contact me directly at the hotel.

Summary: I stayed here for a week while working in Los Alamitos. If you've stayed at a "redone" Residence Inn lately, you know exactly how these rooms look. It's the usual setup with microwave, cooktop, full-size refrigerator, sofabed, etc. My room was spotlessly clean, everything worked fine and the place was pretty quiet. The climate control worked great and was almost completely silent. Breakfast was pretty standard--watery fake eggs, some cooked pork products, some mass-produced pastries, etc. The one night I went to the "social hour," the food was nearly inedible and the beer was Bud Light (gross!). Five stars for the hotel, zero stars for the nasty "food". As usual, the Residence Inn doesn't disappoint for a week-long business trip, but this one needs a new cook.
Manager Response: Dear Joe R - Thank you for your review of the hotel. I am happy to hear that you were pleased with the hotel in general. It is our goal to ensure all of our guests have a pleasant stay and that we exceed in both service and accommodations.  I apologize that you were unhappy with the complimentary food and beverage that the hotel offers. The hot breakfast buffet includes a variety of choices to suit every palate, including real scrambled eggs, prepared with whole pasteurized eggs, a variety of sausage patties and Turkey Canadian bacon as well as up-scale muffins that include both tuxedo muffins and blueberry muffins. In addition, we also serve “make your own” waffles, a variety of breakfast potatoes, yogurt parfaits, breakfast breads such as bagels and English muffins and hot and cold cereals. In regards to the evening social hour, we do rotate the menu every month to include a light meal and complimentary beer, wine and soft drinks. I am sorry that the items served during your stay were not to your liking. We appreciate the feedback from our guests on the food items that they find most enjoyable as well as those that are less desirable so that we can modify our menus to our guests liking. We do serve Bud Light as our complimentary beer of choice due to the overwhelming preference of this domestic beer by the majority of our guests. Please contact me at the hotel to share your personal preferences so that we can ensure your satisfaction during your next stay in the area.

Summary Heading: friendly staff, easy drive to Disneyland
Summary: The hotel looked lovely from the road, modern, clean, with plenty of free parking, about 7 easy driving miles from Disneyland.  We were assigned a room on the first floor which was quite large and well-furnished.  Everything looked nice and clean but the carpet was clearly dirty as our white socks changed color quickly!  I let the manager know and she said she'd make sure it was taken care of before the next customer used the room- great responsiveness and no defensive attitude at all.  Although the closet was big, there were not enough hangers for four people to put clothes and there were no luggage racks - even though they want a "residence" feel, since people do have  short stays here,  they really are necessary.  Also, there are no safes in the room- only at the front desk.

Stayed here Dec 2011 for a week on business visit in studio apt, Room very nice with comfy double bed, 4 ft sofa bed so easy take four people!, kitchen with cooker, fridge and microwave etc so a good self catering option. i always stay as high as possible and this was 3rd floor but place was quite at night in hotel, a little road rumble and the odd chopper from airbase over road, also a fair amount of US service people staying but i enjoyed talking to them. breakfast was selfhelp on fruit , cereals, porridge,toast, scramble eggs, square sausage and all good. eveing food basic but loads of places nearby (out of hotel turn right over road 1st place-Deli- great fish-chips) - Turn left walk 10 mins Redrobin - good chioce, Wed PM is bike night at bar over the road and noisy but best
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind comments! We look forward to your next stay.

Summary: I think we've stayed here at least 10 times in the last 5 years.  It's our hotel of choice when visiting the area.

Two weeks at the Residence Inn in Los Alamitos on business.  The staff were superb, from the front desk to the cleaning staff.  The room was good size, adequate kitchen equipment, excellent internet connection.  The hotel was recommended by my client in Orange County.  Will definitely stay here on future trips.
Very nice  and clean ,affordable ,fresh sheets and towels everyday

Summary Heading: A Good Pick for Business Travel
Summary: When folks in my office travel, any Residence Inn meets our basic requirements: Clean, USG rate, free breakfast and affiliated with a branded company's loyalty program. The Residence Inn Cypress Los Alamitos (RICLA) Web page and other TA reviews influenced our choice to stay here, and everyone was satisfied.  RICLA is conveniently located to freeways. Of course, EVERYTHING in the LA/OC area is convenient to a freeway; however, Katella is a broad thoroughfare and we never had to wait to get out on the road as happens at many places. It's not tucked away behind an industrial area, so you won't miss the place on your way in from the airport (about 45 minutes to LAX, 30 to SNA, and 20 to Long Beach AP). The area is quiet, and if you stay in the rear RICLA overlooks a field, so

We arrived at another hotel in the area which we had booked based on recommendations on this site.  It was horrible and we check out immediately.  We stopped at a local coffee shop with wifi and started looking for another property where we could stay for at least our first night.  We found the Residence Inn - booked it online - then drove to the location.  What a welcome site as we walked into the lobby.  We were greeted with friendly, smiling faces.  Since we had just booked online with hotel.com  the hotel had not yet received the confirmation.  No problem.  They checked us in at the hotel.com rate which was considerably lower that the standard rate.  We arrived at our room and it was great.  It was fresh, clean, and well appointed.  The hotel serves a full complimentary

Summary Heading: Fine for business travel and convenient to Long Beach airport
Summary: Stayed here for three nights last week on business. I worked really long hours so I didn't have time to partake in any of the extras or use the fitness or leisure facilities. I can tell you that when I checked in the woman working at the desk was very friendly. As a single woman traveler, I did feel a little uneasy coming and going from the car to my room in the dark near the rear/side of the complex, especially when I was solo and weighted down with bags. It seemed kind of deserted and although there were parking lot lamps it kind of gave me the creeps. Free in room wi fi also would have been a nice touch. The room was not luxurious but seemed clean and it was quiet. Requests for wake up calls were handled enthusiastically by staff. Enjoyed that windows to my room could open -
Stayed here for work. Was really nice, clean. Spacious suites were great and really good breakfast!

This hotel was a perfect choice for our travel while on business. We enjoyed the fitness center, breakfast, evening dinner along with free drinks and BEER! Our Company always uses this hotel because the people who work here are super dupper nice. Always smile and talk, help with whatever you might have a question on. Enjoyed the wonderful Pool & Hot tub. Valerie & Maryann were amazing employees. We recommend this marriott too everyone.
Stayed at the Residence Inn Cypress for around six weeks.  Very pleased with the hotel/service/staff.  Excellent for business travel.

My wife and I decided to to do a little local getaway and was looking for a place that was quiet and had cooking facilities because we wanted to stay in during our stay. So I did a search and read some of the reviews on TripAdvisor and decided to try it out and man were we glad we did! The hotel is located in a very nice area and was situated near the Los Alamitos Race Track. The facility was immaculate, the grounds spotless, the parking lot was clean as were the the pool and jacuzzi. At check-in, the staff was very friendly as there were throughout our stay. When they found out the reason for our stay, they graciously upgraded us to a one-bedroom suite.  The rooms were nice and roomy and the bed was very comfortable. The bathrooms were roomy as well and nicely setup with plenty

Summary Heading: Smelly bed sheets, extremely uncomfortable sofa bed
Summary: Had to request twice replacement of bed sheets and blanket - they smelled like urine and had stains... ugh!!!  Sofa bed extremely uncomfortable. Still have backpains related to my sleeping on it for almost 10 days.  Twice during our stay sofa bed was not made after cleaning the room. And dishwasher was never emptied, so they kept on washing the same dishes over and over again (only used them once!!!)

Wow, this place in incredibly immaculate!  Should have realized something was different when I first pulled into the parking lot to check-in.  The grounds are well maintained and everything is CLEAN.  The front desk staff were awesome...each and every one of them.  There were four total that checked-in at the same time and they were so apologetic that there was a ‘wait’.  We kept telling them this was NOT an issue as we were all together but the kindness and acknowledgement was something to be noted.  Once we got to the rooms, (as I found out later) all of our jaws dropped.  The cleanliness stood out, the layout very functional and the space very impressive.  Housekeeping was excellent.  There was free Hi-speed internet and free parking.  There was a HOT breakfast every morning

If you think you are getting a roll away bed after reserving one on the Marriot website....think again!  They don't have them here. But they are happy to upgrade you to a room that will accomodate you and your 3 kids at an extra $50.  If you think you are getting your room on time at check in....think again! But they are happy to give you a call when a room is ready.  If you think you can talk to a manager on Saturday...think again! But you can give a call on Monday and hopefully there will be someone to speak with.  If you think you can get helpful info from the front desk...think again! But you can roam the hotel with your bags and 3 kiddos until you find your room.  If you are thinking about staying here...THINK AGAIN!!!

I've stayed at this hotel throughout the years because my regional office is located nearby.  The location is perfect for me. The hotel pretty much has everything. Free parking, free WIFI, complimentary happy hour (keg beer, wine, and dinner), as well as free breakfast in the morning. The rooms are spacious and have full kitchens. In addition, the rooms have two big screen tv's in them.  The only downside is that they don't have room service.

I love this hotel!  They even gave us a free bottle of champagne and a free 25.00 gas card on new years eve!!  There are fantastic people working there and always greet us with a smile.  The rooms smell great and the bedding is so comfortable.  You won't regret staying here!

This is a very nice hotel. Had a room overlooking the pool. Mon-Wed there is a happy hour with a buffet style food. Loved that the water cooler had orange slices nice touch. Breakfast is great and is a FULL buffet sytle breakfast. I did not have my pet with me because I was on business, but I saw others with pets. I will be back.

This is my forth time to stay at this property.  Although a little further from areas I visited, I prefer this location.  It's a short drive to the interstates and to the beaches.  The reception staff was very friendly and helpful.  I was amazed one staff member recalled me from a previous visit two years earlier.  The rooms were carpeted recently.  Our housekeeper was fantastic.  The two bedroom suite is a very good value.  My only complaint about the room is the climate control system is noisy.  While the room was clean, the common areas in the buildings were not kept to the same standard.  The landscaping was kept up well though.  The breakfast was standard.  We utilized the outdoor grill at the Gatehouse to cook and were able eat our supper outside one evening.  Although the

We stayed for a few weeks at the residence inn due to a kitchen fire at our house. The staff was very friendly, and there were a few times where we thought we'd be checking out that day only to find the house still wasn't ready, we never had to move rooms. The rooms were nice and roomy and the beds very comfortable. The couch pull out wasn't however. The bathrooms were roomy as well and nice. Everything was clean. We brought our two cats, and had to pay a pet deposit but they enjoyed themselves. The internet was fast, which was nice to have. The workout room was really nice, not very bit and not much selection but they offered free headphones so you could use the tvs on the machines. The pool and jaccuzi were nice too. The breakfasts were the best I've ever had at a hotel. They

Stayed during December holidays to be near family.  Stay started out ok but ended bad.  My husband and I got food poisoning probably from the hot dogs they had served at the hotel by the pool.  We needed to stay an additional night as we were both very ill and could not drive back to Las Vegas-and me nursing a  7 week old infant.  We were forced to change rooms (they were not full) and the new room was identical in size but with 1 wall missing.  They made us move all of our stuff including baby stroller, car seat, travel bed, bath, etc, in our pajamas-while we hadn't slept, had been throwing up and other stomach troubles-you can imagine - I will not be graphic on that.  We were treated horrible and were really too ill to move.  Terrible experience.  Also there were some shady

We stayed at the Residence Inn earlier this month while attending a convention and were initially quite pleased. The facility is large, new and quite clean overall.   When arriving in our room, we were happy with the layout... two bedrooms with queen beds AND two bathrooms, along with a small kitchen area complete with microwave, refrigerator and dishwasher.   However, there were LARGE stains right inside the front door on the very new carpet which apparently had not been cleaned. One toilet had a substantial leak and standing water in the bathroom which housekeeping was very slow to address.   However, our biggest beef was with the food service. The book in our room stated that breakfast on the weekends ended at 10am... yet when we arrived shortly after 9:30 we were told that

What a great hotel for the price!  $49 for this awesome hotel using priceline.  Rooms are big and awesome with a great flat screen television.  Front Desk was very nice and they serve complimentary breakfast, but we didn't eat.  Okay location, but I assume this place is mostly used by business travelers.  We used it for a Valentine's night getaway.  Beautiful rooms! Don't hesitate to stay here!

Well i like to share my comments regarding my stay at the  Residence Inn Cypress Los Alamitos.  I must say when checking into the hotel it was fast easy and friendly. The rooms  were very nice and clean. And the room service was tremendous house Keeping Great. The pool area and the basket ball area was a great get away for the kids. And now lets talk about the Breakfast it was excellent and so were the kitchen staff.  I must say our stay was for 4 days and when it came to doing laundry, the laundry room was clean and the washing machines dispensed the soap i did not have to bring my own, The machines worked great.   Well back to the room the kitchen  were fully supplied with pots, pans, dishes spoons, forks, glasses dishwasher, ect..... And another thing we stood at  several

First let me say I haven't been to a nice Hotel like this one in a long time, From checking in to breakfast, cleaning, internet, staff, and checking out it was all excellent. Can you believe they even serve afternoon snaks Monday - Wednesday. This Hotel is around a nice area, we didn't even have trouble with the parking like many of the hotels around the Disney area also there Laundry rooms was another plus. My family and I always stay at a hotel around the Disneyland area but thanks to Blanca, MarryAnn, and our cleaning lady, I will always return back to this Hotel. The staff new I was reuniting with my son who I haven't seen since he was 5 years old and now is 24 had made my stay special. When I travel back to visit California My family and I will definitely book this Hotel
The pool is small and good size for young kids.  Great location if you are not going to Disneyland and wanted quiet.

Summary Heading: Residence Inn in Los Alamitos, CA - Terrific Property
Summary: Very nice place - new property. The manager told me that this hotel is a "generation 6" property meaning it had the latest design, amenities and services.  Breakfast and a light dinner is served at no charge. There was a small but well stocked section with a assortment of grocery, soda/beer, snacks, ice cream, etc. at reasonable prices.   Security was good - entrance to all doors except the lobby required the room key.

This hotel is a 3 star as far as the room and buildings, but the staff and amenities are 5 star. We spent a week there with grandkids, and were treated extremely well by everyone. We will definitely return.

Summary Heading: Just what a Marriott should be.
Summary: We recently returned from a Disneyland trip.  We prefer to stay at Marriott Hotels and needed a room that would hold 5 people.  We booked a 2 bedroom suite at this Residence Inn.  We visit the Orange County area at least 2-3 times a year and have our ususal places we stay, but because there were more of us this trip, we needed larger accommodations.  This was perfect!  The hotel is a newer property located in a "Business Park" area.  The neighborhood is good, the front desk staff were very friendly and it was't overly crowded.  Best of all, was the location.  It is only a short drive to Disneyland and Knott's Berry Farm, and a short drive to the Beaches.  The morning breakfast was better than what you get at most other Residence Inn's.  There was typically, Waffles, Eggs every

Summary Heading: Amazing staff - typical high quality for Residence inns
Summary: Being handicapped and how a hotel treats you is one of my main concerns.  They were wonderful from checkin to checkout. Room was spotless, handicap bathroom was thoughtfully designed for ease.  The staff at this property was superb.  Unfortunately my friends could not stay my last night and since I'm in a wheelchair the front desk sent someone to my room in the morning to help me and my luggage to get down to the front of the hotel for the airport service pickup.  He went way beyond the call of duty and then refused to even take a tip for all the wonderful and cheerful help. Your staff are definitely keepers!!!!!

Our stay at this hotel was very pleasant.  The rooms were clean and spacious, and the pool was well maintained and not crowded.  Also, the hotel provides a dinner-time snack and breakfast every day, which were exceptional.  It was very convenient and fun.

This was a great location- nearly new facility and well-run. Great staff, very good hot and cold breakfast options, nice new rooms with stove, refrigerator, sink, dishes, counter, etc. Loved the bed! Internet ready in room. Disney is about 7 miles away and traffic was no problem getting there on Katella Ave. Highly recommend this hotel.

This is a great hotel and we stay here every time visiting the Long Beach/Anaheim/Los Alamitos area.  For our family the two bedroom suites are perfect.  The large rooms have allowed one of our kids to bring along a friend a few times.  Great location between the race track, Disneyland, and in close proximity to Long Beach.  Also our favorite place to eat, Katella Dli, is nearby as well AWESOME hotel!!!

Summary Heading: Very clean place to stay & near Disney
Summary: We have just returned from spending 5 days at this particular Residence Inn while we were on vacation in California.  The hotel is very well maintained and the front desk staff was very friendly.  We stayed in a 2 bedroom/ 2 bathroom suite to accomodate myself,my husband, my sister-in-law & my 2 small children (age 4 & 5 months).  The room was clean and the maid service was also impeccable. Summary Heading: Comfortable and Friendly hotel that accepts pets
Summary: November 8-12, 2006 – Our home was being fumigated and we needed a place to stay with our three pets for four nights.  Our choice was the Residence Inn in Los Alamitos, CA, (called Residence Inn Cypress) about six miles from our home.  Both my wife and I were very happy with every aspect of the hotel.  We had reserved a studio suite for three nights using Marriott Reward points and paid for the fourth night which was $109.00.  Check in was fast and friendly.  We received a ground floor room as requested.  Our suite was #122.  In addition to the room rate, there was a $100.00 charge for our pets.  The studio suite was beautiful! Summary Heading: Typical high quality Residence Inn, good location
Summary: This RI is very new and it shows -  everything is still in tip top shape.  I really preferred the original design of Residence Inn a long time ago, with all the separate 2 story buildings, but since those are no longer being built I'm happy to report that the rooms are still as nice.   The continental breakfast in the morning is really more than it's name - there were plenty of hot items and it's easy to fill up on the selections.  This is no cheap orange juice and donuts type spread; it's a little of everything. My only complaint with this property was that the front desk staff was not at all professional.  Just a bunch of kids goofing off while getting guests checked in and out.  Not a big deal, but not the impression Marriott is going for, I'm sure.

Summary Heading: A great hotel between Long Beach and Disneyland
Summary: We stayed in the Residence Inn for two nights before taking our cruise out of San Pedro.  Great location to everything without having to be on the freeways.  It it so near to Long Beach, Disneyland, Knott's Berry Farm, etc.  It is almost next door to Costco's and near to some  grocery stores (Ralph's).  Having been in RI's before, we found this one up the the high standards we expect them to be. We especially loved the weeknight meals and breakfasts.  The room was nice and quiet.  Did not use the pool as it was too cold outside (major winter storm).  Staff was helpful and friendly. The staff, the site, the price all make this worth every cent!  It is a newer property!  I alwas feel as if I am the only client there when we arrive.  It is very close to all things in the SEal beach/Long Beach area and you will enjoy the stay!

A great place to stay while in Los Angeles/Anaheim area! We had five adults and we fit nicely in the two bedroom suite with sofa bed. Staff was excellent and always friendly. Went the extra mile with us first night there offering us tickets to Jay Leno that another guest was unable to use. Breakfast buffet was plentiful and great selection of foods. Nice court yard area to relax in. Quiet place to stay in a great location. Close to Disneyland and Knotts Berry Farm. Would definately stay there again! A+++++++++
